    No member of the plumbing board charged with the duties of the board in connection with the enforcement of the plumbing code shall thereby render himself liable personally and any such member is hereby relieved from all personal liability for any damage that may occur to persons or property as a result of any act required or permitted in the discharge of his duties. Any suits brought against any such member shall be defended by the office of the city attorney until the final termination of the proceedings. 
(Ord. No. 10-70, § 14, 7-14-70) 
Sec. 5:215. - General requirements for those engaged in plumbing contractual work; certificates of competency, renewals; bonds; insurance; licenses; inspections, reinspections; reciprocal certificates. 
(a)  Certificates required. It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to carry on or engage in the business of plumbing work in the City of Eunice, Louisiana, unless such person has had issued to him a plumbing contractor or plumber's certificate of competency by the plumbing board in the manner and in accordance with the provisions of this subchapter, except as otherwise provided for in this subchapter. All persons must possess a certificate issued by the state board of examiners of journeyman plumbers. 
(b)  Renewal of certificates. Each certificate of competency shall be issued for one year, from January first to December thirty-first. Each such certificate may be renewed from year to year upon payment of the fee required, unless such certificate has been cancelled or revoked. Renewals shall be made within thirty (30) days from the date of expiration and any certificate not renewed shall become null and void. 
(c)  Revocation of certificate. The plumbing board may cancel or revoke any certificates issued by them if the person to whom such certificate was granted later shows incompetency or lack of knowledge in matters relevant to such certificate. The board may require such person to appear before them for examination. 
(d)  Registration. Before any one shall carry on or engage in the business of plumbing work or labor at the trade of plumbing, he shall first register his name and address with the plumbing inspector, with all information required. 
(e)  Contractor's bond. Every person, firm or corporation must, before engaging in the plumbing contracting business, deposit with the city clerk of the City of Eunice a plumbing contractor's bond in the principal sum of five thousand dollars ($5,000.00) executed by two (2) or more solvent sureties or a solvent surety company conditioned that the principal therein shall faithfully comply with the terms of this subchapter and shall indemnify and hold harmless the City of Eunice, Louisiana, and all of its officials, employees and agents against all costs, expenses, damages and injuries sustained by the negligence of such principal, his agents, servants and employees, or his failure to comply with the terms of this subchapter in doing work made the subject matter hereof, and otherwise to be in the form and executed as required by the City of Eunice. The bond shall be renewed annually on the first of January as a prerequisite to the issuance of a plumbing contractor's certificate of competency for that year. 
(f)  Public liability insurance. Each and every licensed plumbing contractor shall carry public liability insurance in the amount of at least fifty thousand dollars ($50,000.00). 
(g)  License required. Before anyone shall carry on or engage in the business of plumbing in the City of Eunice, Louisiana, he or it shall first procure a contractor's license from the city clerk of the city and pay the license fee imposed on such business as per the occupational license law. No such license shall be transferable. 
(h)  Proof of possession of license. Every applicant for plumbing contractor's license shall furnish proof that he is the lawful possessor of a valid certificate of competency. If the applicant is a partnership, firm or corporation, some bona fide member or authorized agent thereof shall be the possessor of a valid certificate of competency who shall at all times be in actual charge of the plumbers performing the work and be physically present on the work site at least fifty (50) per cent of the working hours per day. When any person is designated as agent for the applicant, as above designated to act as his agent, one copy of which shall be filed with the city clerk of the City of Eunice, Louisiana; provided, however, that any person, firm or corporation heretofore licensed and authorized who has contracted for plumbing work shall be permitted to continue and contract until completed upon payment of all fees required. 
(i)  License not transferable. No person holding a contractor's license issued by the City of Eunice shall lend such to any other person to do any plumbing work under any permit taken out in his name, except certified plumbers in his employ. A violation of this paragraph shall be grounds for the revocation of such person's license, in addition to other penalties provided for by this subchapter. 
(j)  Must have an established place of business. Every licensed plumbing contractor must have and maintain an established place of business in the City of Eunice. He must and shall have someone in attendance to receive complaints or notices from the plumbing inspector or plumbing board. His place of business must be where he can be reached by patrons. 
(k)  Must hold a certificate to advertise as such. It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation not in legal possession of a valid certificate of competency issued by the plumbing board of Eunice, Louisiana, to engage in or carrying on the business of plumbing contractor in the city, or to use the words "plumbing contractor" in any advertising, or to display or expose a sign having imprint for the purpose of implying the advertiser to be so engaged. 
(l)  Final inspection. Upon completion of all plumbing work in any building or on any premises and the notification to the plumbing inspector has been made, the plumbing inspector shall cause an inspection of the work to be made. If the work is properly done, the inspector shall sign the inspection approval card and date same. 
(m)  Notice of defects. If after any inspection the plumbing work is found to be faulty, incorrectly or defectively installed, the plumbing inspector shall notify the person authorized by the permit to do the work or the change to be made in order that the work will conform to the requirements of this subchapter. For each reinspection, a fee shall be charged to the person authorized by the permit to do the work. The person shall, within forty-eight (48) working hours from notification, make or commence to make the changes ordered. 
(n)  Continued notices of defects and reinspections. If the plumbing inspector should upon reinspection find the work incorrectly installed, he shall collect an additional reinspection fee. If the required changes are not made within a reasonable time, the plumbing inspector shall refuse to issue to such person any additional permits until the faulty work has been corrected. 
(o)  Plumbing work shall be approved. It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to knowingly allow or permit the use of the plumbing fixtures in the installations until such plumbing work has been inspected, tested and approved by the plumbing inspector. 
(p)  Reciprocal certificates. The plumbing board may, in lieu of the examination called for in this subchapter, accept of the applicant's competency and record from any city having like qualifications, and such applicant who applies for examination and registration may be registered without examination by the plumbing board. 
(Ord. No. 10-70, § 15, 7-14-70; Ord. No. 9-86, 8-12-86) 
Sec. 5:216. - Permits required for plumbing installations; applications for permits and inspections; homeowner's permits. 
(a)  No property owner shall cause or permit any connection with a house sewer, nor the erection of any plumbing or fixtures to be connected therewith, without first obtaining from the plumbing inspector a permit therefor before the work is commenced. Applications for such a permit shall be made on the form prescribed, stating the location of the property, the name of the licensed plumber to be employed, with a full and clear description of the work proposed, signed by the owner or authorized agent and agreeing that the owner will conform with the rules and ordinances regulating sewer connections and plumbing. Each application shall be accompanied by a diagram and specifications made in duplicate on the form prescribed and furnished by the inspector, showing and describing clearly the location of the building and of the rooms containing the work, the connections with the sewer, with every pipe, fixture and connection, neatly drawn in ink. If one vertical section cannot be made to show the work fully, other drawings are to be added. In showing extensions, the old work is to be shown in red ink and all new work in black ink. 
(b)  No permit is required for minor work such as repair of leaks in pipes, traps, drains, faucets or opening up waste or supply pipes or replacing broken fixtures. 
(c)  If the application and plans are approved by the inspector, he shall issue a written permit within twenty-four (24) hours after the application is filed. 
(d)  Any plumbing contractor not licensed in the city must hold a state contractor's license and shall obtain a working permit of fifty dollars ($50.00) for each job in the city. 
(e)  Approved plans may not be changed unless the change is submitted and approved in the same manner as the original plans. 
(f)  The same plans may serve for each of several buildings located together and having identical plumbing. 
(g)  Each permit will lapse if the work is not completed within ninety (90) days from the date of the permit unless a longer period is expressly allowed by the inspector. 
(h)  No permit shall be issued to any person to do or cause to be done any construction or work regulated by this subchapter except to a person, firm or corporation holding a valid, unexpired and unrevoked certificate of competency. 
(i)  Any permit required by this subchapter may be issued to any person to do any construction or work regulated by this subchapter in a single-family dwelling and accessory building used exclusively for living purposes in the event that any such person is the bona fide owner of any such dwelling and accessory building and the same are occupied by the owner; provided, that the owner shall personally purchase all material and shall personally perform all labor in connection therewith; and provided, that said owner can answer questions and draw such sketches as are required by the plumbing inspector to show that he has sufficient knowledge and skill to install the plumbing work in a safe manner and in accordance to the rules and regulations of this subchapter. 
(Ord. No. 10-70, § 16, 7-14-70; Ord. No. 28-80, 9-8-81) 
Sec. 5:217. - Inspections and tests. 
(a)  All sewer lines shall be inspected when the pipe has been laid and cemented and before it is covered. As soon as all soil pipes, waste pipes, vent pipes and traps are connected, they shall be tested by the plumber in the presence of the inspector by filling them with water. If any leaks appear, they are to be stopped by removal of the broken or defective pieces, caulking the leak or tightening screw threads, but not by use of plumbers cement. In addition to the water test, an approved smoke test or a pressure test may be used in the presence of the inspector. 
(b)  All work must be left uncovered and convenient for examination until inspected and approved. 
(c)  No water shall be turned on except for inspection, and no plumbing fixtures shall be used until the inspector has issued his certificate of final inspection and approval. 
(d)  This certificate shall not relieve the plumbing contractor of his responsibility for any defective work that may have been concealed or escaped the inspector. 
(Ord. No. 10-70, § 17, 7-14-70) 
Sec. 5:218. - Violations, penalties. 
    Whoever violates the provisions of this subchapter, or any section thereof shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall, upon conviction by the city judge, be punished as provided in Section 1:21 of this Code. 
Sec. 5:218.1. - Certification required for demolition. 
    Before any demolition permit is issued for any structure to which a sewer line is attached, the city sewer line must be properly sealed off and inspected by the city building inspector for approval. 
(Ord. No. 0299(A), 3-9-99) 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 0299(A), adopted March 9, 1999, added a new provision numbered as § 5:218. Inasmuch as there already exists provisions designated with that number, the editor has redesignated said new provision as § 5:218.1, to avoid duplication. 
Sec. 5:219. - Certification required for moving of structure. 
    Before any permit is issued by the city permitting the moving of a structure, building or mobile home, the sewer line must be properly sealed off and inspected by the building inspector for approval. 
(Ord. No. 0299(A), 3-9-99) 
Secs. 5:220-5:249. - Reserved. 
PART II. - SEWERAGE AND SEWERAGE DISPOSAL[3] 

Footnotes: 
--- (3) --- 
Cross reference- Related provisions dealing with sewerage, § 25:50. 

Sec. 5:250. - Material specifications for kinds of pipes, joints or couplings used as parts of city's sanitation system; violations, penalties. 
(a)  All persons, firms, corporations or anyone whomsoever laying sanitary sewer service pipe within the corporate limits of the city, whether the same be service line pipe, yard pipe and/or drains, shall employ and use nationally recognized gasket joint pipe as prescribed hereafter: 
(1)  Extra-strength vitrified clay pipe conforming to the latest specifications for extra-strength pipe, American Society for Testing Materials Designation C-200-59T, with factory-fabricated joints or couplings on the spigot and bell ends of the pipe, conforming to American Society for Testing Materials Designations C-425-58T, Type I, Type II, or Type III Specifications. 
(2)  Asbestos-cement sewer pipe conforming to American Society for Testing Materials Designation C-248-59T with fittings made with sleeve couplings of the same composition as the pipe, sealed with rubber rings. 
(3)  Bitumized fibre pipe meeting American Society for Testing Materials Designation 186-61T, with fittings made with tapered type couplings of the same material as the pipe. 
(b)  It shall be unlawful to employ any other kind or quality pipe, joints or couplings other than that specified in the above and foregoing section, and anyone employing any other kind or quality pipe, joints or couplings to be used in or forming a part of the sanitation system of the City of Eunice, Louisiana, which includes service lines, yard lines and/or drains, or violating any other provision of this part shall be fined a sum of not less than two hundred dollars ($200.00) or imprisoned not more than thirty (30) days, either or both, at the discretion of the city judge. 
(Ord. No. A-276, §§ 1, 2, 11-12-63) 
Editor's note- The maximum penalty set out in the above section was revised to $200.00 in conformance with the ordinance adopting this Code. 
Secs. 5:251-5:274. - Reserved. 
SUBCHAPTER D. - AIR CONDITIONING, HEATING, MECHANICAL REFRIGERATION AND VENTILATION[4] 

Footnotes: 
--- (4) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 30-80, adopted Nov. 10, 1981, amended Ch. 5 by adding a new Subch. D, §§ 5:219-5:235. Inasmuch as the placement of this subchapter at §§ 5:219-5:235 would cause it to be placed between Parts I and II of Subch. C, the editor, at his discretion, has incorporated these new provisions as §§ 5:275-5:291 of this chapter. 

Sec. 5:275. - Adoption of air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation code; object and scope of code. 
    This subchapter shall apply to and include all air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work, installation or equipment installed, constructed or altered in or about a building or structure of any kind, class or character, or used, or to be used for any purpose whatsoever. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:219, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:276. - Adoption of standard mechanical code; enforcement of air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation code; decisions variations, modifications. 
(a)  The City of Eunice adopts by reference the rules and regulations as set forth in the Standard Mechanical Code, and the 1978 revisions thereto, promulgated by the Southern Code Congress, as amended, together with basic principles accompanying this act, and said rules and regulations are hereby incorporated by reference in this subchapter as fully as if set out in full herein. These rules and regulations are to be considered an integral part of the Eunice Air Conditioning, Heating, Mechanical Refrigeration and Ventilation Code and are hereby legalized as such, and shall be taken by all the courts of the State of Louisiana and by all public officials to have the same force and effect as if included in this subchapter. 
(b)  The air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board may vary the application of any provision of the Standard Mechanical Code, together with its amendments, modifications and additions, in any particular case when in its opinion the enforcement thereof would do manifest injustice and would be contrary to the spirit and purpose of this subchapter or the public interest or when in its opinion the interpretation or decision of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector should be modified, reversed or disallowed. 
(c)  A decision of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board to vary the application of any provision of the Standard Mechanical Code or to modify, reverse or disallow an interpretation or order of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector shall specify in writing in what manner such changes are made, the condition upon which it is made and the reasons therefor. 
(d)  It is hereby declared to be the intention of the board of aldermen that the amendments to the City of Eunice Air Conditioning, Heating, Mechanical Refrigeration and Ventilation Code herein adopted shall be deemed to be incorporation in said code so that a reference to the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation code of the City of Eunice shall be understood and intended to include such amendments. 
(e)  The air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board shall in every case render an opinion and/or decision without unreasonable or unnecessary delay. 
(f)  Varying, modifying, revising or disallowing the interpretation or order of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector shall require the affirmative votes of the majority present, but not less than three (3) affirmative votes shall be required. No board member shall act in a decision in which he has a personal or direct interest. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:220, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:277. - Office of air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector; qualifications and appointment. 
(a)  An air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector shall be appointed by the mayor, by and with the approval of the board of aldermen of the City of Eunice, Louisiana. 
(b)  The salary to be paid the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector shall be determined by the board of aldermen. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:221, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:278. - Duties of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector; applications for permits, inspections. 
(a)  The air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector shall have the duty: 
(1)  To issue all permits for air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work. 
(2)  To inspect and pass upon all air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work and inspect any air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work of any character already in use or being constructed which he may have reason to believe is out of repair or imperfect. 
(3)  To maintain public office hours, receive applications for permits, review plans and specifications for work to be performed, keep records of all permits issued and work performed, maintain an official register of persons, firms or corporations qualified and licensed to engage in the business of air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work in the city. 
(b)  It shall be unlawful for the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector to engage in the business of the sale, installation or maintenance of air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration or ventilation directly, but he may have a financial interest in a concern engaged in such business. 
(c)  The air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector shall have the right to enter any building or premises in the discharge of his duties. 
(d)  When any air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration or ventilation is found to be defective or defectively installed, the party responsible shall be notified in writing and shall make any changes or repairs required or needed to place such in safe and working condition and if such work is not completed within fifteen (15) days, or any longer period granted in said notice, the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector shall have authority to stop the further construction or use of such air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation until it has properly constructed or repaired. 
(e)  If in the judgment of the inspector work being done in a manner prohibited by this subchapter will foreseeably endanger public citizenry or public property or the property of other owners, then he shall have the power to compel the suspension of any air conditioning, heating, mechanical, refrigeration or ventilation work being performed by issuing a cease and desist citation which, if not complied with, shall immediately be heard by the Eunice City Court on an instanta basis within seventy-two hours of the issuance of the citation. Any work performed after notice of the citation is served upon a contractor and prior to a hearing before the Eunice City Court shall be a violation of this subchapter. 
(f)  Prior to the issuance of a permit, an application for permit shall be made on the form prescribed, stating the location of the property, the name of the licensed air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation worker to be employed, with a full and clear description of the work proposed, signed by the owner, that the work will conform with the rules and ordinances regulating air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation. 
(g)  No permits are required for minor work. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:222, 11-10-81; Ord. No. 09-04(B), 9-14-04) 
Sec. 5:279. - Air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board; organization, qualifications. 
(a)  There is hereby created the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board of the City of Eunice, which shall consist of six (6) members. The members shall be appointed by the mayor by and with the advice and consent of the board of aldermen and shall serve for terms as prescribed and provided for herein and shall serve as a body to administer the provisions of this subchapter. 
(b)  The members of the board shall include: 
    One plumber, licensed to do business in Eunice; 
    One electrician, licensed to do business in Eunice; 
    One alderman of the City of Eunice; 
    One plumbing inspector of the City of Eunice; 
    One general contractor (resident), or realtor doing business in Eunice; 
    One air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractor licensed to do business in Eunice. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:223, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:280. - Duties of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board. 
(a)  The air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board shall have and is hereby given full power and authority to prepare and promulgate such rules as may be deemed necessary to carry out the provisions herein, provided the same are not inconsistent with the provisions of this subchapter. The board shall establish standards and procedures for the examination and qualifications for licensing of air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractors and shall issue or cause to be issued an appropriate certificate to each person, firm or corporation who meets the qualifications and passes the examination given by the board. The board shall act in an advisory capacity pertaining to all work with and in the jurisdiction of this subchapter. 
(b)  The board shall review any interpretation or ruling relative to this subchapter by the inspector when requested to do so by any such person. 
(c)  Any such decisions or rulings rendered by the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration or ventilation board shall be final and conclusive unless within thirty (30) days from the date thereof the aggrieved party shall seek relief therefrom in any court of competent jurisdiction as provided by the laws of the State of Louisiana. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:224, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:281. - Authority of the plumbing board to revoke, suspend air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation licenses. 
    The board shall, subject to approval of the board of aldermen, have the power to revoke or suspend a license or certificate of any air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration or ventilation contractor or firms or corporations to whom said certificates or licenses are issued who are found guilty of a violation as set forth in this subchapter. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:225, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:282. - Revocation, suspension of air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation licenses, procedure. 
(a)  Before a certificate may be revoked or suspended, the licensee shall have notice, in writing, enumerating the charges and shall be entitled to a hearing by the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board, not sooner than five (5) days from receipt of notice. The licensee shall be given an opportunity to present testimony, oral or written, and shall have the right to cross examination. All testimony shall be given under oath. The board shall have the power to administer oaths, issue subpoenas and compel the attendance of witnesses. The decisions of the board shall be based upon the evidence produced at the hearing and made part of the record thereof. 
(b)  The board may suspend or revoke any certificate of registration for refusal to comply with the recommendations of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector and violations of this subchapter. 
(c)  No certificate shall be revoked until a public hearing has been held by the board at which hearing the registrant may appear in person or be represented by counsel. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:226, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:283. - Qualifications of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board. 
(a)  It shall be a requirement that each member of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board be a registered voter of the city. The appointments shall be for terms as follows: of the members first appointed, two (2) shall be appointed for a term of one year; two (2) shall be appointed for a term of two (2) years and two (2) shall be appointed for a term of three (3) years. Vacancies shall be filled for an unexpired term in the manner in which the original appointments are required to be made. 
(b)  The board will elect a chairman and vice-chairman and secretary from its membership to serve for a period of twelve (12) consecutive months and who will be eligible for re-election upon expiration of a term. 
(c)  The board shall keep a record of all proceedings and the secretary shall file the same with all proper city and state agencies as required by law. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:227, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:284. - Regular meetings of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board. 
    The air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board shall hold its regular meetings on the second Monday prior to regularly scheduled council meetings of January, April, July and October of each year for the purpose of performing its duties. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:228, 11-10-81; Ord. No. 48-82, 5-13-82) 
Sec. 5:285. - Special meetings of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board. 
    The mayor or his authorized representative may call a special meeting of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:229, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:286. - Quorum of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board. 
    Four (4) members of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board shall constitute a quorum. Any board member who has a direct or indirect personal interest in a consideration, examination or application for a certificate shall recuse himself as a board member for said consideration. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:230, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:287. - Procedure for the examination of applicants and the granting of certificate of competency as an air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractor. 
(a)  At a regularly scheduled meeting of the board, any person, firm or corporation desiring a certificate of competency shall make application in writing to the board, to wit: 
(1)  An individual applicant shall file a personal resume giving information as to work experience, education, current financial statement, bank reference and two (2) personal references from local residents, firms or corporations. 
(2)  A firm or corporation making application shall furnish a financial statement, bank reference, two (2) personal references from local residents, firms or corporations doing business in Eunice. After filing the required documents with the board, the board will determine the eligibility of the applicant to be examined at the time of application. 
(b)  If the applicant is ruled eligible, the board will give a written examination to the applicant no sooner than three (3) days nor less than ten (10) days from date of the application (weekends and legal holidays excluded). 
(c)  Grading of the applicant's examination shall take place within seventy-two (72) hours after examination is completed and then forwarded to the chairman of the board. 
(d)  The grade given to the examination shall not be available to any board member, official of the city, citizen, firm or corporation until the board has convened an official meeting at which time the grading of the examination shall be checked and verified by the board members in closed session. 
(e)  If the applicant has successfully passed the examination, the board shall issue a certificate of competency authorizing the applicant to do business in the city in the classification of work allowed by the certificate. 
(f)  If the applicant has failed to pass the examination, the board shall so notify the applicant and show him evidence of failure. 
(g)  The applicant then may refile for examination to be taken no sooner than ten (10) days nor less than thirty (30) days from date of filing. The same procedure for examination previously prescribed shall be followed. 
(h)  If applicant fails to pass the second examination, he shall forfeit the examination fee and not be eligible for re-examination for a period not less than six (6) months from date of the last examination. 
(i)  Any air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractor not licensed within the city must hold a certificate from any other Louisiana governmental body or take the test administered by the city and shall obtain a working permit of fifty dollars ($50.00) for each job in the City of Eunice. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:231, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:288. - Permit fees for air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation workers and contractors; renewal fees; date due; delinquency. 
(a)  The following fees shall be charged each applicant for registration and shall be paid at the time the application is filed: 
(1)  Air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation workers ..... $25.00 
(2)  Air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractors ..... 25.00 
(b)  All certificates of competency shall expire on December 31st of each year and must be renewed on or before February 1st of the following year. Renewal fees are charged as follows: 
(1)  Air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation workers ..... $25.00 
(2)  Air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractors ..... 25.00 
(c)  The registration fees shall be due January 1st and become delinquent February 1st of the same year. Delinquent applications shall carry a twenty-five (25) per cent penalty in fees. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:232, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:289. - Personal liability of members of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board. 
    No member of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board charged with the duties of the board in connection with the enforcement of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation code shall thereby render himself liable personally and any such member is hereby relieved from all personal liability for any damage that may occur to persons or property as a result of any act required or permitted in the discharge of his duties. Any suits brought against any such member shall be defended by the office of the city attorney until the final termination of the proceedings. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:233, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:290. - General requirements for those engaged in air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractual work; certificates of competency, renewals; bonds; insurance; licenses; inspections, reinspections. 
(a)  Certificate of competency required. It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to carry on or engage in the business of air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work or to labor at the trade of installing air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation equipment in the City of Eunice unless such person has successfully passed an examination conducted by the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board, and has had issued to him an air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation certificate of competency by the board, in the manner and in accordance with the provisions of this subchapter, except as otherwise provided for in this subchapter. All persons, firms or corporations which have been licensed and qualified to perform air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work in the city for the immediate past three-year period shall be issued certificates of competency on their application to the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board without the necessity of taking an examination and upon payment of the fees provided for. 
(b)  Reciprocal certificate. The air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board may, in lieu of the examination called for in this subchapter, accept of the applicant's competency any record from any city having like qualifications, and such applicant who applies for examination and registration may be registered without examination by the electrical board. 
(c)  Renewal of certificates. Each certificate of competency shall be issued for one year, from January 1st to December 31st, and shall remain in force and effect for that period, unless sooner revoked. Each such certificate may be renewed from year to year, upon payment of fee required, without further examination, unless such certificate has been cancelled or revoked. Each such renewal shall be made within thirty (30) days from the date of expiration of the certificate, and any certificate which is not renewed shall become null and void. 
(d)  Revocation of certificate. The air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board may cancel or revoke any certificate of competency issued by them if the person to whom the certificate was granted later shows incompetency or lack of knowledge in matters relevant to the certificate; if the certificate was obtained by fraud, the board may require such person to appear before it for examination or re-examination. 
(e)  Registration. Before any person, firm or corporation shall carry on or engage in the business of air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work or labor at the trade of installing air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation equipment in the city he shall first register his name and address with the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector, together with information as may be required, except as otherwise provided for in this subchapter. 
(f)  Contractor's bond. Every person, firm or corporation must, before engaging in the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contracting business, deposit with the city clerk an air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractor's bond in the principal sum of five thousand dollars ($5,000.00) executed by two (2) or more solvent sureties or a solvent surety company authorized to do business in the State of Louisiana, conditioned that the principal therein shall faithfully comply with the terms of this subchapter and shall indemnify and hold harmless the city and all of its officials, employees or agents against all cost, expense, damage and injury sustained by the negligence of such principal, his agents, servants and employees, or his failure to comply with the terms of this subchapter in doing work made the subject matter hereof, and otherwise to be in the form and executed as required by the city. The bond shall be renewed annually on the first day of January of each year as a prerequisite to the issuance of an air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractor's certificate of competency for the year. 
(g)  Public liability insurance. Each and every licensed air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractor shall carry public liability insurance with an insurance agency authorized to do business in the State of Louisiana in the amount of at least fifty thousand dollars ($50,000.00). 
(h)  License required. Before any person, firm or corporation shall carry on or engage in the business of installing air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation equipment in the city he or it shall first procure a contractor's license from the city clerk of the city, and pay the annual license fee imposed on such business, as per the occupational license law. No such license shall be transferable. 
(i)  Every applicant for an air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractor's license shall furnish proof that he is the lawful possessor of a valid certificate of competency. If the applicant be a partnership, firm or corporation, some bona fide member or authorized agent thereof shall be the possessor of a valid certificate of competency who shall at all times be in actual charge of the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation workers performing the work. When any person is designated as agent for the applicant, one copy of said written designation shall be filed with the city clerk. 
(j)  Expiration of license. All contractor's licenses shall expire on the thirty-first day of December of each year unless sooner revoked. 
(k)  License not transferable. No person holding a contractor's license issued by the city shall lend such license to any other person or allow any other person to do any air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work under any permit taken out on his name, except certified air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractors in his employ. A violation of this paragraph shall be grounds for the revocation of such person's license, in addition to other penalties provided for by this subchapter. 
(l)  Must have an established place of business. Every licensed air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractor must have and maintain an established place of business in the City of Eunice. He must and shall have someone in attendance to receive complaints or notices from the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector or the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board. His place of business must be where he can be reached by patrons. 
(m)  Must hold a certificate to advertise as such. It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation not in legal possession of a valid certificate of competency issued by the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation board to engage in, carry on or represent himself, itself or themselves as engaging in or carrying on the business of an air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractor in the city or to use the words "air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation contractor" in any advertising or to display or expose a sign having imprint for the purpose of implying the advertiser to be so engaged. 
(n)  Approval of roughing-in. When the rough-in air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work has been completed on any premises and the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector notified, he shall cause an inspection to be made of the work. If the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work has been installed in accordance with the provisions of this subchapter and meets the requirements of the code, the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector shall sign the inspection card, noting thereon the date of approval. More than one rough-in inspection may be made without additional charge when the type of progress of construction requires such inspection. 
(o)  Final inspection. Upon the completion of all air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work in any building or on any premises and the notification to the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector has been made, the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector shall cause an inspection of the work to be made. If such work is found to be correctly installed, replaced or repaired, and in accordance with the requirements of this subchapter, the inspector shall sign the inspection approval card, noting thereon the date of approval. 
(p)  Notice of defects. If after any inspection (rough-in or final) and before issuance of approval card, the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work is found to be faulty, incorrectly or defectively installed, the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector shall notify the person authorized by the permit to do the work on the change to be made in order that the work will conform to the requirements of this subchapter. 
(q)  Reinspection and fee. For each and every reinspection made necessary by faulty, incorrectly or defectively installed air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation work, a reinspection fee as set out in this subchapter shall be paid by the person authorized by the permit to do the work. 
(r)  Limits to correct defects. The person authorized by the permit to do the work shall, within forty-eight (48) working hours from the time of notification, make or commence to make the changes ordered, and shall proceed with the work until the changes are completed. Upon completion thereof and payment of the reinspection fee, the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector shall then cause a reinspection to be made and if the work is found to comply with the code, he shall sign the inspection card noting thereon the date of approval of the work. 
(s)  Continued notices of defects and reinspection. If the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector should upon reinspection find the work incorrectly installed, he shall collect an additional reinspection fee. If the required changes are not made within a reasonable time, the air conditioning, heating, mechanical refrigeration and ventilation inspector shall refuse to issue to such person any additional permits until the faulty work has been corrected and approved. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:234, 11-10-81) 
Sec. 5:291. - Violations, penalties. 
    Whoever violates the provisions of this subchapter or any section thereof shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction shall be punished as provided in Section 1:21 of this Code. 
(Ord. No. 30-80, § 5:235, 11-10-81) 
Secs. 5:292-5:299. - Reserved. 
SUBCHAPTER E. - MISCELLANEOUS REGULATIONS 

Sec. 5:300. - Installation of drainage pipes and culverts in ditches and drainage canals. 
(a)  Prior to the installation of any culvert or pipe in any city ditch or canal a certificate of authority must be obtained from the city showing the size of pipe or culvert specified necessary for review and approval by the city engineer. 
(b)  Prior to installation a copy of this certificate shall be available on site during the installation of the drainage facilities. 
(Ord. No. 12-79, §§ 1, 2, 8-22-79) 
Editor's note- Ordinance No. 12-79, §§ 1, 2, adopted Aug. 22, 1979, enacted the provisions codified as § 5:300 of a new Subch. E herein. Since said ordinance did not expressly amend the Code, the manner of codification has been at the editor's discretion. 
Sec. 5:301. - Buildings and other structures which endanger the public welfare or safety. 
(a)  It shall be unlawful for the owner of any lot, place or area and/or any building or other structure within the City of Eunice, whether occupied or unoccupied, to have or use a building or other structure which, by reason of its nature or condition, endangers the public welfare or safety. 
(b)  A building or structure, whether occupied or unoccupied, that is not secured, is declared to presumptively constitute a danger to the public welfare and safety. 
(c)  A building or structure is not secured if the building has doors or windows which are open or does not have doors or windows or other appurtenances at entrances or other appropriate locations of the building or structure and has no other means to keep persons from entering the building or structure. 
(d)  A building or structure is further declared to be a danger to the public welfare or safety when it is found to be in violation of any public health, housing, fire or environmental code or, if the building or any structure may endanger the health, life, limb or property of any person or cause any hurt, harm, damages, injury or loss to any person due to any one (1) or more of the following conditions: 
(1)  The property is: 
a.  Dilapidated, decayed, unsafe or unsanitary; 
b.  Is detrimental to health, moral safety, public welfare and the wellbeing of the community; 
c.  Endangers life or property or is conducive to ill health, delinquency, and crime. 
(2)  The property is a fire hazard. 
(3)  The conditions present in the building or structure are not reasonably or adequately maintained, thereby causing deterioration and creating a blighting influence or condition on nearby properties and thereby depreciating the value, use and enjoyment to such an extent that it is harmful to the public health, welfare, moral safety and the economic stability of the area, community or neighborhood in which such building or structure is located. 
(e)  On the first conviction of said ordinance, the offender shall be punished by a fine not to exceed one hundred dollars ($100.00). Imposition of a fine may be suspended and in lieu thereof, the court may require the offender to correct all existing conditions or violations with regard to the property which render it a danger to the public welfare. 
(f)  On the second conviction of said ordinance, the offender shall be punished by a fine not to exceed three hundred dollars ($300.00). Additionally, the court may require that the offender correct all existing housing violations on the property. 
(g)  On any third or subsequent conviction, the offender shall be punished by a fine not to exceed five hundred dollars ($500.00) or ordered to perform not more than fifteen (15) hours of community service, or both. Additionally, the court may require that the offender correct all existing housing violations on the property. 
(h)  All charges brought for any violation of this ordinance shall require that the owner and any other party in interest be given reasonable notice of the date and hour of the arraignment, trial and any other proceedings in this matter. 
(i)  Upon failure of a property owner to pay any fine levied as provided by this ordinance, the governing body of the City of Eunice may file a certified copy of the order levying the fine or fines in the Mortgage Records of the St. Landry Parish Clerk of Court and same, when so filed and recorded, shall operate as a lien and privilege in favor of the City of Eunice against the property. 
(j)  Further, in addition to the fine levied as a lien provided above, the fine shall bear legal interest as provided in LRS 9:3500. Further, the lien obtained by the City of Eunice shall include not only the fine provided for and legal interest as provided for above, but shall include all attorney's fees and costs incurred in the location of the owner, the notification of the owner and the enforcement and collection of the amount secured by the lien. 
(k)  After the City of Eunice has levied such fines, the city tax collector may add said amounts to the next ad valorem tax bill of the owner and/or owners of said property and structure and said amount shall be subject to the same interest and penalties as delinquent ad valorem taxes. 
(l)  If, within six (6) months after the filing of the lien provided for above the property owner fails to pay such lien and any interest thereon, the tax collector for the City of Eunice may offer for sale and subsequent sale or otherwise convey such property. The procedure for notice, advertisement and sale of the property shall be governed by the law applicable to the sale of real property for delinquent city or parish taxes except that the property owner's right of redemption shall be limited to six (6) months from the time the property is sold. Redemption by the original owner shall require reimbursement of any expenses incurred by the purchaser in the purchase and renovation of the property in addition to payment of liens placed on the property pursuant to this section, interest thereon, and any amounts required by law applicable to the redemption of the property sold for delinquent taxes. 
(m)  Alternatively, the privilege and lien of the City of Eunice may be enforced in district court pursuant to the Louisiana Code of Civil Procedure and may be enforced either against the subject property or against the owner personally by ordinary process and subsequent seizure and sale or garnishment, whether movable or immovable property of the owner, pursuant to Louisiana Code of Civil Procedure. 
(n)  The provisions of this section shall not apply to any building or appurtenance on agricultural land when such land is used for agricultural purposes. 
(o)  The city building inspector, city code enforcement officer or any police officer or other law enforcement officer is authorized to enforce complaints arising under this section. 
(Ord. No. 03-07(A), 3-13-07) 
State Law reference- Authority to provide rules, regulations and fines for owners of buildings which endanger the public welfare or safety, LRS 33:4754. 
Secs. 5:302-5:310. - Reserved. 
SUBCHAPTER F. - HISTORIC DISTRICT COMMISSION 

Sec. 5:311. - Commission established. 
    There is hereby created a commission to be known as the "Historic District Commission" of the City of Eunice. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 1, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 1, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:312. - Recommendation and appointment of members. 
    The commission shall consist of seven (7) members and shall be appointed by the mayor. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 2, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 2, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:313. - Vacancies. 
    Each of the members of the commission shall be appointed for a term of four (4) years. The chairman shall be elected by the members of the commission. Whenever the term of a member of the commission expires, the mayor shall appoint his successor. The members may serve consecutive terms. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 3, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 3, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:314. - Rules, regulations and guidelines; meetings; reports and recommendations. 
    The commission shall make such rules and regulations as it may deem advisable and necessary for the conduct of its affairs non-inconsistent with the laws of the city and state. The commission shall meet monthly, but meetings may be held at any time by the commission on the written request of any of the seven (7) members or on the call of the chairman of the commission or the mayor. The commission shall make quarterly reports to the mayor and council containing a statement of its activities. Copies of the rules, regulations and guidelines are available at the historic district commission office. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 4, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 4, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:315. - Purpose. 
    The historic district commission shall have for its purpose the preservation of all structures in the historic district section of the city which have architectural and historical value and which should be preserved for the benefit of the people of the city and state. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 5, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 5, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:316. - Definition of historic district. 
    The following area of the City of Eunice is hereby designated as the Eunice Historic District, to wit: Second Street from Laurel Avenue south to Park Avenue; Walnut Street from C.C. Duson west to Third Street, Park Avenue from C.C. Duson west to Third Street. The historic district above designated shall include all building sites or lots and all structures, houses or other buildings facing any of the streets on the perimeter of the area. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 6, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 6, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:317. - Submission of plans to commission for exterior changes. 
(a)  The owner of any property within the historic district shall apply for a permit from the commission before the commencement of any work in: 
(1)  The erection of any new building or other construction in the Eunice Historic District; or 
(2)  The alteration or addition to any existing structure in the Eunice Historic District; or 
(3)  The repairing or demolishing of any existing building situated within the Eunice Historic District. 
(b)  The application therefore shall be made to the commission, accompanied by the full plans and specifications thereof so far as they relate to the proposed appearance, texture or materials and architectural design of the exterior, including the front, sides, rear and roof of such buildings, alteration or addition of any building or outbuilding, party wall, courtyard, sidewalk, fence or other dependency thereof. 
    Permit applications and pertinent information may be obtained at the historic district office located at the mayor's office, 300 South Second Street, phone (318) 457-7389. 
    Permit applications should be submitted to the historic district commission seven (7) [days] prior to the date of the next commission meeting. The historic district commission meetings are held the first Monday of each month at noon in the mayor's conference room. 
    Permit applications shall be accompanied by the appropriate information, i.e., photographs, paint color samples, plans specifications and elevations. All applications shall include a color photograph of the dwelling or structure for which the applicant is seeking a permit. Incomplete applications shall not be processed. 
(c)  Where, by reason of topographical conditions, irregularly shaped lots, or because of unusual circumstance applicable solely to the particular applicant, strict enforcement of the provisions of this subchapter would result in serious undue hardship peculiarly affecting said applicant, then the commission, in passing upon his application; shall have the power to vary or modify adherence to this subchapter provided always that its requirements insure harmony with the general purposes hereof, and will not adversely affect the historic district as a whole. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 7, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 7, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:318. - Commission recommendation and action thereon. 
    The Eunice Historic District Commission shall, upon due consideration, render its decision concerning the approval or disapproval of the issuance of the permit, which may include such changes, if any, as in its judgement are reasonable necessary to comply with the requirements of this subchapter, and send its decision, in writing, to the applicant and the building inspector. If the permit is approved, the building inspector shall issue promptly a permit for such work in conformance with the commission's decision. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 8, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 8, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:319. - Appeals. 
    Any person or persons aggrieved by any decision, act or proceeding of the Eunice Historic District Commission shall have a right to apply in writing to the city council for reversal or modification thereof and the mayor, or presiding officer of the city council, shall have the right to stay all further action until the city council shall have had an opportunity to rule thereon. Any such appeal shall be taken in ten (10) days from date of the written decision, and the city council may consider said appeal at its next general or special meeting, but in any event, not more than forty-five (45) days thereafter, the city council may affirm a decision of the historic district commission by majority vote of all its members. The city council shall have the right to reverse, change or modify any decision of the historic district commission by majority vote of all its members. 
    Any person or persons aggrieved by any decision of the city council affecting said historic district shall have the right to file a civil suit within thirty (30) days from the date of decision in a court of competent jurisdictions under the usual rules of procedure governing same, with the right to stay order and injunctive relief provided the situation warrants it. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 9, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 9, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:320. - Injunctions. 
    Whenever any person has engaged in or is about to engage in any act or practice which consulates or will constitute a violation of this subchapter, the commission may make application to the appropriate court for an order enjoining such act or practice, or requiring such person to refrain from such prospective violation or to remedy such violation by restoring the affected property to its previous condition. Upon a showing by the commission or the city that such person has engaged or is about to engage in such act or practice, a permanent or temporary injunction, temporary restraining order, or other appropriate order shall be granted without bond. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 10, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 10, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:321. - Penalties. 
    Any owner, agent, lessee or other person acting for or in conjunction with him who shall violate the Eunice Historic District or law or rules, regulations or decisions of the commission, shall be fined not less than fifty dollars ($50.00), nor more than one hundred dollars ($100.00) for each infraction. Each day that a violation continues shall constitute a separate offense. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 11, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 11, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:322. - Stopping work commenced without permission. 
    The building inspector shall promptly stop any work attempted to be done without or contrary to a permit issued under this subchapter and shall promptly prosecute any person responsible for such a violation of this subchapter or engaged in such violation. Any officer or authorized agent of the commission shall exercise concurrent or independent powers with the building inspector in prosecuting violations of this subchapter and stopping work attempted to be done without or contrary to the permits reported by the ordinance. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 12, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 12, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:323. - Provisions of subchapter prevail in case of conflict. 
    The provisions of this subchapter shall govern and take precedence over any other provisions of any ordinance or codes of the City of Eunice. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 13, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 13, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:324. - New construction. 
    Proposals for new construction in the Eunice Historic District should seek compatibility with existing structures through the appropriate use of site planning, materials, decorative details, architectural elements and scale. A proposal should not draw unnecessary attention to itself in any one of these characteristics. However, a proposal need not duplicate or copy historic styles and periods. The architectural context is of primary concern. 
(1)  Scale. The relationship of the building and its elements (including doors and windows) to other structures in the district. It is important in considering scale, that a careful study be made of the height, width and mass of buildings in the immediate neighborhood and district as a whole. This study should serve to confirm or deny the appropriateness of the height, width and mass of the proposed building. Maximum Height of any new structure shall conform to U.S. Department of Interior guidelines for historic districts. In no case shall a new structure exceed a height of seventy-five (75) feet above the street. 
(2)  Sitting. The positioning of a building on a lot. This process includes determining the setback of a building, the spacing of this building from adjacent buildings, and the location of the walls, fences, walks, drives and landscaping, if any of these are used in the overall design. 
(3)  Materials. The surface building fabric which contributes to the exterior character and appearance of a building. 
(4)  Decorative details. Ornamentation or embellishment. These includes cornices, lintels, arches, balustrades, chimneys, shutters, columns, and other common details. When used, details should create a unifying effect on a building and should be compatible with the contest of the neighborhood. 
(5)  Architectural elements. Parts of a building that are integral to its composition. These include balconies, roofs, porches, chimneys, dormers, parapets and other parts of a building that contribute to its overall shape and silhouette. The choice and arrangements of elements of a proposed building should reflect those of other buildings in the neighborhood. The building should not draw unnecessary attention to itself by failing to relate to neighboring styles, but neither should it necessarily copy these styles. The object is to compliment the context of the Eunice Historic District. The Eunice Historic District Commission shall follow the guidelines established by the United States Department of the Interior in considering all proposals for new construction and/or rehabilitation. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 14, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 14, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:325. - Fences. 
    Fence design must be in harmony with the nature of the district. 
    The following fencing materials are generally acceptable: iron picket, ornamental cast iron, brick, concrete block with cement-plaster coating, combinations of iron and masonry, wood picket-flat boards or square, solid wood flat-topped or capped. 
    The following fencing materials are not acceptable: Barbed wire, concrete block, stockade, plywood, hardboard, asbestos board or chain-link. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 15, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 15, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:326. - Overhanging balconies. 
    No overhanging balconies or galleries of wrought or cast iron may be removed, but other new or additional balconies may be erected if they conform to the quaint and distinctive architecture of the Eunice Historic District. The permit for all such new construction or any renovation shall be subject to the requirements of this subchapter. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 16, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 16, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:327. - Signs. 
(a)  Definitions. The following terms, as used in this section are hereby defined as follows: 
(1)  Sign shall include any symbol, device, image, poster, flag, banner, billboard, design or directional sign used for advertising purposes, whether painted upon, attached to, erected on, or otherwise maintained on any premises containing any words, letters or parts of letters, figures, numerals, phrases, sentences, emblems, devices, trade names or trademarks by which anything is made known, such as are used to designate an individual, a firm, an association, a corporation, a profession, a business or a commodity or product, which is visible from any public street and is used to attract attention. 
(2)  Display includes erect, paint, repaint, place, replace, hang, rehang, repair, maintain, paint directly upon a building or other structure, inlay, imbed in, or otherwise exhibit in public view. 
(b)  Signs must conform to character of section. In addition to the prohibitions contained in this section, approval of the display of a sign in the Eunice Historic District of the city shall be granted by the commission only when such signs and the plans thereof, so far as they relate to the appearance, color, size position, method of attachment, texture or materials and design, conform to the quaint and distinctive character of the Eunice Historic District, or do not injuriously affect it or impair the value to the community of those buildings having architectural or historical worth. 
(c)  No signs to be displayed in certain places. No sign shall be displayed from the parapet or roofs of any buildings in the historic district. No sign shall be displayed or placed in any manner whatsoever so as to disfigure or conceal any significant architectural feature or detail of any building. 
(d)  What signs may advertise. No sign of any character shall be displayed in the Eunice Historic District unless such sign advertises a bona fide business conducted in or on the premises and, if it does do so, no more than fifty (50) per cent of the area of such sign may be used to advertise products or commodities actually sold on the premises. 
(e)  Number of primary signs. In general one primary sign is allowed to each store, shop, or bona fide place of business, and this sign shall be no larger than the maximum stipulated in this section. 
(1)  In the case of a business operated on a corner lot that faces two (2) streets, one primary sign on each street facing is allowed and shall be regulated as if each side were a separate storefront. 
(2)  In the case of a single sign being inappropriate, multiple primary signs may be used, the total face area of which may not exceed the maximum size stipulated in this section. 
(f)  Surface area of signs. The surface area of any sign shall be in direct proportion to the amount of front footage of each ownership and shall be as follows: 
(1)  For single-faced signs, attached flat against the wall and including painted wall signs, there shall be allowed forty (40) square inches sign surface area to each foot of lot frontage. 
(2)  For double-faced signs, suspended by brackets or arms perpendicularly from the wall signs there shall be allowed thirty (30) square inches sign surface area to each foot of lot frontage. 
(3)  In the case of multiple businesses operating at a single location, the total face area of signage may be increased to one and one-half (11/2) times the maximum stipulated in this section. 
(g)  Secondary signs. In addition to the primary sign(s) referred to in subsection (e), small secondary signs may be used to identify the following: 
(1)  Entrance doors. 
(2)  Operating hours. 
(3)  Temporary signs. 
(h)  Temporary signs. Temporary signs of a promotional nature may be placed on the interior of store windows. In no case may they remain longer than sixty (60) days. A permit is not required for the placement of a temporary sign. Temporary signs may be placed on the exterior of a building for the following special situations: 
(1)  For the identity of real estate for sale. 
(2)  For political advertisement. Except for signs larger than a two (2) foot by two (2) foot yard sign, no application is required. 
(3)  For promotion by nonprofit organizations. In no case may these signs exceed the size limitations of this section. 
(i)  Portable and changeable letter signs. No portable or changeable letter signs may be erected or allowed to remain with the Eunice Historic District. 
(j)  No illuminated signs may be constructed or erected within the Eunice Historic District without the express approval of the historic district commission. 
(1)  Concealed lighting is recommended. Bulbs may not be exposed. The light should enhance the sign as well as the building on which it is mounted. 
(2)  Internally illuminated signs are not permitted. 
(3)  Flashing signs are not permitted. 
(k)  Signs no longer complying as to advertisements to be taken down. Any sign displayed which no longer advertises a bona fide business conducted upon the premises shall, upon notification by the Eunice Historic District Commission or its agent (who is hereby specifically authorized to so proceed) be taken down, removed or obliterated within five (5) days after such notifications and failure to so comply on the part of the owner, occupant, agent or person having the beneficial use of any building or premises upon which such sign may be found shall subject such person to the penalty provided in Section 5:321. 
(l)  Building code applicable to signs. All signs under this section shall be further governed by existing regulations of the building code of the city which are not in conflict with this section. 
(m)  Application for signs to be submitted to commission. All applications for permits to display signs within the historic district of the city shall be submitted to the historic district commission office for approval before a permit therefor may be issued in conformity with Section 5:319. 
(n)  Form of application to display signs. Accompanying drawings application for a permit to display signs in the historic district of the city shall be made to the commission upon forms furnished by the commission. Such an application shall also be accompanied by sketches and drawings in triplicate showing details of construction and foundation when required by the building code of the city and shall delineate the size, design, coloring, lighting and position in relation to the building from or upon which it shall be displayed. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 17, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 17, 9-8-98; Ord. No. 10-14, 11-11-14) 
Sec. 5:328. - Aerials, antennas, etc., prohibited. 
    The construction of aerials, antennas or satellite dishes of any type within the Eunice Historic District is prohibited without the express approval of the Eunice Historic District Commission. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 18, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 18, 9-8-98) 
Sec. 5:329. - Facade lighting. 
    Facade lighting must be approved by the commission. 
(Ord. No. 996(E), § 19, 9-27-96; Ord. No. 998(A), § 19, 9-8-98) 
Chapter 6 - CIVIL DEFENSE 
SUBCHAPTER A. - LOCAL CIVIL DEFENSE ORGANIZATION 

Sec. 6:1. - Creation of local civil defense organization. 
    There is hereby created a local organization for civil defense, pursuant to the provisions of R.S. 29:608 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950. 
(Ord. No. A-188, § 1, 5-13-58) 
Comment- LRS 29:608, cited above, authorizes and directs municipalities and police juries to establish local civil defense organizations and generally sets forth the organization and duties of such local agencies. For additional provisions concerning the state civil defense program, see LRS 29:601 et seq. 
Sec. 6:2. - Appointment of local civil defense director; responsibilities and duties. 
(a)  The local organization for civil defense shall have a director who shall be appointed by the state director of civil defense upon the recommendation of the mayor and board of aldermen. The local director shall have direct responsibility for the organization, administration and operation of such local organization for civil defense subject to the direction and control of the local governing body under the general direction and control of the governor through the state civil defense agency. 
(b)  The local director shall execute and enforce such orders, rules and regulations as may be made by the governor through the state civil defense agency. 
(Ord. No. A-188, § 2, 5-13-58) 
Comment- Originally, appointment of the local director for civil defense was made by the Governor upon the recommendation of the Mayor. This procedure was applicable at the time Ordinance No. A-188 was enacted. Since the adoption of Ordinance No. A-188, state law has been revised to give the state director of civil defense the power of appointment. The above provisions were, therefore, revised to make them consistent with state law. 
Sec. 6:3. - Acceptance of gifts and contributions from state and federal agencies. 
    When the federal or state government or any agency or officer thereof shall offer this political subdivision service, equipment, supplies, materials or funds by way gifts, grants or loans for purposes of civil defense, the director on behalf of the Governor, with the consent of this governing authority, may accept such offer and is authorized to receive such aid and assistance. 
(Ord. No. A-188, § 3, 5-13-58) 
Comment- See LRS 29:610 for general authority of local civil defense agencies to accept gifts and grants for civil defense purposes. Also see LRS 53:2 for similar authority. 
Sec. 6:4. - Director to prepare civil defense operations plan, recruit other personnel, etc. 
    The director is authorized and directed to prepare a detailed plan for civil defense operations in this political subdivision and to recruit and train personnel in accordance with the plan to the end that when disaster strikes, each member of this local organization will know his part and his duty. 
(Ord. No. A-188, § 4, 5-13-58) 
Sec. 6:5. - Director authorized to utilize services of other city departments and agencies; city personnel required to cooperate. 
    The director is hereby authorized to utilize the services, equipment, supplies and facilities of existing departments, officers and agencies of this political subdivision to the maximum extent practicable and the officers and personnel of all such departments and agencies are directed to cooperate and extend such services and facilities to the Mayor and the director on request. 
(Ord. No. A-188, § 5, 5-13-58) 
Chapter 7 - FIRE PREVENTION AND PROTECTION[1] 
Footnotes: 
--- (1) --- 
Cross reference- Building regulations, Ch. 5; housing code, Ch. 11. 

SUBCHAPTER A. - FIRE PREVENTION CODE 

Sec. 7:1. - Adoption of fire prevention code. 
    There is hereby adopted by the City of Eunice, Louisiana, for the purpose of prescribing regulations governing conditions hazardous to life and property from fire or explosion, that certain code known as the Fire Prevention Code, recommended by the American Insurance Association, being particularly the 1970 edition thereof and the whole thereof, save and except such portions as are hereinafter deleted, modified and amended, of which code not less than three (3) copies have been and now are filed in the office of the clerk of the City of Eunice, Louisiana; and the same are hereby adopted and incorporated as fully as if set out at length herein, and from April 9, 1974, the provisions thereof shall be controlling within the limits of the City of Eunice, Louisiana. 
(Ord. No. 6-74, § 1, 4-9-74) 
Secs. 7:2-7:99. - Reserved. 
SUBCHAPTER B. - MISCELLANEOUS FIRE REGULATIONS 

Sec. 7:100. - Fire trucks to be given right-of-way; parking near fires restricted; duty of motorists upon approach of fire trucks; violations, penalties. 
(a)  Whenever the fire apparatus is called out for duty in the City of Eunice, it shall have the right-of-way over any and all streets, avenues and alleys in the city. No unauthorized person shall be allowed to race with or follow the fire apparatus to a fire, except as provided in paragraph (b) hereof, or to park or stop an automobile within three hundred (300) feet of the fire on the street on which the fire is. 
(b)  All unauthorized persons hearing the approach of the fire apparatus shall bring their automobiles or other vehicles to a stop on the right-hand side of the street and not to start again until the apparatus is at least two (2) blocks distant. 
(c)  Any person or persons violating this section, or any part thereof, shall be punished in accordance with Section 1:21 of this Code. 
(Ord. No. 159, §§ 1-3, 12-1-25) 
Comment- The penalty provision of the ordinance from which the above section was derived was revised to conform to the ordinance adopting this Code. 
Sec. 7:101. - Fire district-Established; limits set; restrictions. 
(a)  Fire district established. There shall be a fire district in the City of Eunice, Louisiana, within which fire district the regulations established by the Southern Building Code, Chapter 3, Sections 301-1 through Section 305 and Section 602 through Section 606.3, shall govern the construction, alteration and moving of buildings and structures, as per an attached copy of Chapter 3, Section 301-1 through Section 305 and Section 602 through Section 606.3, made a part of this section. 
(b)  Fire limits. Said fire district limits shall be and the same are hereby established as per "Map of Fire District, City of Eunice, Louisiana," prepared by Aucoin and Associates, Inc., dated June 18, 1985, attached hereto and made part of this section. 
(c)  Zoning restrictions.
