A rebuttable presumption of the existence of control or a controlling interest shall arise from the beneficial ownership, directly or indirectly, by a person or group of persons, acting in concert, of fifty (50) percent or more of grantee. As used herein, control or a controlling interest may be held simultaneously by more than one person or groups of person. 
(n)  Drop means the cable or other wires that connect a subscriber's television receiver or other terminal to the nearest feeder cable of the system. In the case of drops to schools or public buildings, as required hereunder, drops shall not include wiring beyond the entry point to any particular building; provided, however, that grantee shall perform any such internal wiring at a cost no greater than its actual cost, including the actual cost to grantee of labor by its employees. 
(o)  Installation means the process of installing a drop and completing connection of the system. 
(p)  Property of grantee means all property including but not limited to wires, cables, poles, satellite dishes, connectors, converters and other equipment owned, installed or used by grantee, as well as contractual and legal rights of any kind or nature whatsoever, used in connection with operation of the system. 
(q)  Public building means any building owned, leased or otherwise lawfully occupied or used, all or in part, by the franchising authority within the franchise area. 
(r)  Resident means any person occupying a home or place of business in the franchise area. 
(s)  School means any public educational institution, including primary and secondary schools, colleges and universities, and all similarly situated private and parochial educational institutions which have received appropriate accreditation from the State of Louisiana. 
(t)  Subscriber means any person or user of the cable system who lawfully receives cable service or other service therefrom. 
(u)  HDTV means high definition television, as it may be defined by the Federal Communications Commission and/or as may be determined by industry practice during the term of any franchise granted hereunder. 
(v)  Basic service or basic cable service means any service tier which includes the retransmission of local television broadcast signals. 
(w)  FCC means the Federal Communications Commission and any federal agency that may be its successor in regulation of cable television. 
(x)  Clerk means the city clerk or the clerk of the City of Eunice City Council. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § I, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:42. - Nonexclusive franchise required. 
(a)  This franchise shall be nonexclusive and no person, firm, corporation or other entity shall install, construct, operate and maintain a cable television system within all or a specific portion of the city without first obtaining a nonexclusive franchise from the city. 
(b)  The city council may grant other nonexclusive franchises to install, construct, operate and maintain cable television systems within all or a specific portion of the city, provided, however, that no such franchise shall be granted on terms or conditions more favorable or less burdensome than imposed herein. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § II, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:43. - Term. 
    The term of this franchise shall be fifteen (15) years commencing on the date of acceptance hereof, pursuant to Section 8:48 hereof. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § III, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:44. - Authority granted by franchise. 
(a)  Subject to any rules, regulations, and/or restrictions of the United States (or any of its agencies), the State of Louisiana (or any of its agencies), and/or contained herein, this franchise shall authorize and permit the grantee to do the following: 
(1)  Erect, install, construct, repair, replace, reconstruct, maintain, and retain in, on, over, under, across, and along any public right-of-way, such poles, wire, cable, conductors, ducts, conduit, vaults, manholes, amplifiers, appliances, attachments, and other property as may be necessary and appurtenant to the cable system; and in addition, to use, operate, and provide similar facilities or properties rented or leased from other persons, firms or corporations, including but not limited to, any public utility or other grantee of any franchise of this city. 
(2)  Maintain and operate facilities and properties for the collection, transmission, retransmission, conduction, amplification, conversion, and distribution of programs and other services by use of electricity, radiation, or other energy source. 
(3)  Solicit, sell, distribute, and make a charge to subscribers within the city for connection to the cable system of grantee, subject to the regulation of rates or charges by the city as may be permitted by federal law. 
(4)  Perform tree trimming as necessary to protect the safety of grantee's equipment, as approved by the city, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § IV, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:45. - Renewal of the franchise. 
    All renewals of this franchise shall be performed in accordance with state and federal law. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § V, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:46. - Franchise acceptance. 
(a)  This franchise shall not become effective for any purpose unless and until written acceptance thereof shall have been filed with the city; and such written acceptance shall be in the form and substance as shall be prescribed by the city and shall include, if so required by the city, appropriate guarantees by any parent corporation or other owners of the grantee. 
(b)  Such written acceptance shall operate as an acceptance of each and every term, condition, restriction and limitation contained in this chapter, and in said franchise. 
(c)  Such written acceptance shall be filed not more than thirty (30) days following the effective date of the ordinance granting said franchise; and in default of the filing of such written acceptance as herein required, grantee shall be deemed to have rejected the same. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § VI, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:47. - Franchise requirements. 
    In addition to any other franchise requirements hereunder, or made or adopted as herein provided, the following requirements shall apply: 
(a)  In consideration of the granting and exercise of this franchise to use the public rights-of-way of the franchise area for the purpose of operating a cable system for the use and benefit of subscribers therein and for other rights granted hereunder, the grantee shall pay to the city during the entire life of the franchise, semiannually within sixty (60) days after January 1 and July 1 for the preceding twelve (12) months, a franchise fee in an amount equal to the greater of five (5) percent of its gross revenues, as defined herein, or the maximum percentage allowed under 47 USC 542 of its gross revenues, derived from the operation of grantee's cable system in the city. 
(b)  With each such payment, grantee shall provide for the applicable period a statement or report by an officer of grantee setting forth in detail the method and manner of the calculation of the franchise fee due. 
(c)  Any franchise payments to the city by grantee shall not be in lieu of any occupation, income, license, or property tax or similar levy, assessment, fee, or charge which would otherwise apply to and be payable by the grantee. 
(d)  Upon acceptance of this franchise, grantee shall file with the city and shall thereafter during the entire term of such franchise maintain in full force and effect a corporation surety bond of one hundred thousand dollars ($100,000.00) conditioned that in the event grantee fails to comply with one or more of the provisions of such franchise or of this subchapter, then there shall be recoverable jointly and severally from the principal and surety and damages or costs suffered or incurred by the city or by any subscriber as a result thereof, including, but not limited to, attorney's fees and costs of any action or proceeding, and including the full amount of any compensation, indemnification, cost of removal of any property or other costs which may be incurred up to the full principal amount of such bond; and said condition shall be a continuing obligation during the entire term of such franchise and thereafter until grantee shall have satisfied in full any and all obligations to the city and any subscriber which arise out of this section, nor any bond accepted by the city pursuant hereto, nor any damages recovered by the city thereunder shall be construed to excuse a lack of faithful performance by the grantee, or limit the liability of grantee under any franchise issued pursuant to this chapter. 
(e)  Upon acceptance of the franchise, grantee shall file with the city and shall thereafter during the entire term of the franchise maintain in full force and effect a comprehensive liability policy of insurance with limits of not less than one million dollars ($1,000,000.00) for each occurrence and five million dollars ($5,000,000.00) aggregate, and such policy shall provide primary coverage for the city, its council members, its officers, boards, commissions, agents and employees against liability for loss or damage for personal injury, death, property damage or other loss of any kind occasioned by any activity or operation of grantee under its franchise. 
(f)  Grantee shall indemnify and hold harmless the city, its council members, officers, boards, commissions, agents and employees against any and all claims, demands, cause of actions, actions, suits, proceedings, damages (including but not limited to damages to city property and damages arising out of copyright infringements, and damages arising out of any failure by grantee to secure consents from the owners, authorized distributors, or licensors of programs to be delivered by grantee's cable television system), costs or liabilities (including costs or liabilities of the city with respect to its employees) of every kind and nature whatsoever, including, but not limited to damages for injury or death or damage to person or property, and regardless of the merit of any of the same, against and from all liability to others and against any loss, cost and expense resulting out of or arising out of any of the same including any attorney's fees, accountant's fees, expert witness fees, consultant fees, court costs, other defense costs, per diem expense, traveling and transportation expense, or other costs or expense arising out of or pertaining to the exercise or the enjoyment of any franchise hereunder by grantee or the granting thereof by the city. 
(g)  Grantee shall at the sole risk and expense of grantee, upon demand of the city, appear in and defend any and all suits, actions, or other proceedings, whether judicial, quasi-judicial, administrative, legislative, or otherwise, brought or instituted against or had by third persons or duly constituted authorities against or affecting the city, its council members, officers, boards, commissions, agents or employees, arising out of or pertaining to the exercise or the enjoyment of such franchise, or the granting thereof by the city. However, grantee shall not be required to appear in and/or to defend any suits arising solely from the city's acts. 
(h)  Grantee shall pay and satisfy and shall cause to be paid and satisfied any judgment, decree, order, directive, or demand rendered, made or issued against grantee, the city, its council members, officers, boards, commissions, agents or employees in any of these premises; and such indemnity shall exist and continue without reference to or limitation by the amount of any bond, policy of insurance, deposit, undertaking or other assurance required hereunder, or otherwise. Grantee shall have no liability for acts arising solely from the city's acts. In order for the grantor to assert its rights to be indemnified and held harmless, the grantor must: 
1.  Promptly notify grantee of any claim or legal proceeding which gives rise to such right; 
2.  Afford grantee the opportunity to participate in and fully control any compromise, settlement, resolution or disposition of such claim or proceeding; 
3.  Fully cooperate in the defense of such claim and make available to grantee all such information under its control relating thereto. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § VII, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:48. - Construction and use of facilities. 
(a)  Prior to commencement of construction of the distribution system or any portion thereof or of any extension thereto, grantee shall submit to the city a construction schedule and map showing in detail the geographic location of each portion of the franchise area to be constructed or installed during such construction period, and shall construct the distribution system in accordance with such schedule. 
(b)  Grantee shall utilize existing poles, conduits, and other facilities whenever possible, and shall not construct or install any new, different, or additional poles, conduits or other facilities without first securing the written approval of the city council, provided that the privilege of grantee to construct, install, or replace any poles, conduits, or other facilities, in, on, under or over any right-of-way shall at all times be subject to the right of the city in the exercise of its police power or pursuant to the terms hereof, upon reasonable notice to grantee, to require any such poles, conduits, or other facilities of grantee to be constructed, installed, placed, or replaced beneath the surface of the public rights-of-way; and any such construction, installation, placement, replacement or changes which may be so required shall be made at the expense of grantee. 
(c)  Grantee shall at the expense of grantee, protect, support, temporarily disconnect, temporarily relocate, remove or permanently relocate any property of grantee when, in the opinion of the city engineer, such is required by reason of highway or street construction or repair; bridge construction or repair; the alteration, change or establishment of the grade of any street, highway, alley or other public ways; the construction, installation or repair of sewers, drains, waterlines, power lines, signal lines, buildings or other structures; or, the movement of buildings. If city compensates any utility for such relocation, then grantee shall be similarly compensated. Grantee shall be permitted to recover costs associated with the relocation of private structures. 
(d)  In the event the use of any part of the system of grantee is discontinued for any reason for a continuous period of thirty (30) days, without prior written notice to and approval by the city council, or in the event any part of such system has been installed without complying with the requirements hereof, or in the event any franchise shall be terminated, canceled, or renewal denied and all appeals exhausted, grantee shall, at the option of the city council, promptly remove all property of the grantee, and grantee shall promptly restore the street or other area from which such property has been removed to such condition as the city engineer shall approve; provided the city council may, upon written application therefor by grantee, approve the abandonment of any such property in place under such terms and conditions as the city council may prescribe; and upon abandonment of any such property in place, grantee shall cause instruments as the city shall prescribe and approve, conveying the ownership of such property to the city. 
(e)  Grantee, shall obtain permits from the city for all "street cuts" or other excavations made in connection with installation, operation or maintenance of the system and shall repair such street cuts or excavations to such condition as existed before said work. 
(f)  Upon the failure, refusal or neglect of grantee to cause any work or other act required by law, by the terms of the franchise agreement, or by this subchapter to be completed within any time prescribed therefore, and upon notice given, where notice is required, the city council may cause such work or other act to be completed in whole or in part, and upon so doing shall submit to grantee an itemized statement of the costs thereof, and grantee shall within thirty (30) days after receipt of such statement, pay unto the city the entire amount thereof. 
(g)  The running of any time period as may be necessary in relation to this section, shall be automatically tolled whenever and so long as any necessary approvals or authorizations required from the FCC are subject of a petition for stay, petition for review, or appeal. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § VIII, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:49. - Standards. 
(a)  Grantee shall: 
(1)  Be capable of relaying to subscriber terminals television and/or radio broadcast signals, (including those in a HDTV format), as well as cable programming available by satellite, including but not limited to cable premium channels, cable services to be included in basic service, and pay-for-view programming. 
(2)  Distribute color television signals which it receives; 
(3)  Provide one government access channel, without charge for the exclusive, noncommercial use of the city, having a channel position standardized among all franchises granted by the city; however, such standardized position shall not be required if financial or technical reasons prevent such a position, or the standardized position is not possible due to federal or state regulations. Upon request of the city, grantee shall provide coverage of regular and special meetings of the city. 
(4)  Have a minimum capacity of sixty (60) channels capable of transmitting broadcast signals, including those in an HDTV format. 
(5)  Include an emergency alert system, upon issuance of applicable standards by the FCC, whereby on request from the city, grantee shall be capable of inserting simultaneously on all channels an audio and/or video warning of any emergency, such as approaching hurricanes or tornadoes, or chemical spills. 
(b)  No business or residential unit, including residential units within a complex shall be refused service; provided, however, that the grantee shall not be required to provide service to any subscriber who does not pay the applicable fee or service charges. Grantee shall not be required to provide service to an area where the density of homes is less than twenty (20) homes per aerial cable mile or forty-five (45) homes per underground cable mile. 
(c)  Planned interruptions of service, insofar as possible shall be preceded by notice given to subscribers' twenty-four (24) hours in advance and shall occur during periods of minimum use of the system. 
(d)  Grantee shall maintain an office within the city, which shall be open during all usual business hours, with its telephone number listed in the directories of all telephone companies servicing the city, which office shall be operated so that complaints and requests for repairs and/or adjustments may be received at any time, day or night, seven (7) days a week, and provide notice of such office and the grantee's general complaints procedure to each subscriber, at the time of initial subscription to the system. In the event grantee's office, telephone number of general complaint procedure is changed, grantee shall notify all subscribers in writing; such notice may be included in the next monthly billing sent to subscribers. 
(e)  Grantee shall maintain a written record or "log" listing the date of written customer complaints, identifying the subscriber and describing the nature of the complaint, and when and what action was taken by grantee in response thereto. Said record shall be kept at grantee's local office for a period of two (2) years and shall be available for inspection during regular business hours, without further notice or demand, by the city council or its designee. 
(f)  Grantee shall provide the city at no charge one free drop for reception of its service at each government building, or building used all or in part by the city, including but not limited to schools, as defined herein, police and fire stations, libraries, and health care facilities; basic service through all such drops at no charge. Internal wiring of buildings shall be at a cost to the city not to exceed grantee's actual costs, including the actual labor cost of its employees. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § IX, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:49.1. - Limitations. 
    In addition to any other franchise limitations hereunder or as herein provided, the following limitations shall apply: 
(a)  This franchise shall be nonexclusive and neither the granting thereof nor any of the provisions contained herein or in such franchise shall limit, abridge, diminish, alter, or affect the right, privilege, power, or authority of the city council. 
(b)  The grant of any privilege pursuant to this franchise shall be subordinate to any prior lawful occupancy of any public right-of-way or other public property or the grant of any privilege under any other franchise of prior date, insofar as there shall be any conflict. 
(c)  The franchise granted herein shall not be transferred or assigned by the grantee without written notice to the grantor. This franchise or control of grantee cannot in any event be sold, transferred, leased, assigned, or disposed of in whole or in part either by force or involuntary sale, merger, or consolidation or otherwise without the prior consent of the City of Eunice. Any such transfer, assignment, or transfer of the controlling interest in grantee shall require approval in advance of the City of Eunice expressed by ordinance and shall be made only by an instrument in writing, a duly executed copy of which shall be filed in the office of the clerk of the City of Eunice not less than thirty (30) days in advance of such transfer or assignment. 
(d)  Grantee shall have no recourse or remedy whatsoever against the city for any loss, cost, expense or damage arising out of or with respect to granting this franchise or the enforcement thereof, except for actions seeking equitable relief or as otherwise provided for herein. 
(e)  Grantee shall be subject to all ordinances, rules, regulations and specifications of the city heretofore or hereafter established or amended, including but not limited to those pertaining to works or activities in, on, over, under public rights-of-way, or other public places or property. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § X, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:49.2. - Inspection of books and records. 
    Grantee shall allow the authorized representative of the city council to inspect and audit all data and records of grantee relating to its compliance with the provisions of this franchise. Such inspection shall be made during normal business hours. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § XI, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:49.3. - Grounds for revocation. 
    In addition to all other rights of the city in law or in equity, and subject to grantee's rights to notice of default and applicable curative periods, the city shall have the right to revoke this franchise, and all rights and privileges pertaining therein, in the event that grantee: (1) breaches any material provision of the franchise or commits a material act of default hereunder; (2) willfully practices any fraud or deceit upon the city or subscribers; or (3) fails to pay franchise fees as required hereunder; or (4) fails to provide continuity of service, as required herein. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § XII, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:49.4. - Revocation procedure. 
    Any revocation of the franchise shall be undertaken in accordance with the following procedures: 
(a)  The city shall notify grantee, in writing, of the alleged grounds for revocation, specifying those grounds with reasonable particularity. 
(b)  Grantee shall, within thirty (30) days after receipt of such notice, or such longer period of time as the city may specify in such notice, either immediately cure the alleged grounds for revocation or, in a written response to the city, either present facts and arguments in refutation or excuse, or state that such alleged grounds will be cured and set forth the method and time schedule for accomplishing such cure. 
(c)  If based on information provided by grantee, the city determines that one or more grounds for revocation continues to exist and that either such grounds are not excusable or have not been or will not be cured by grantee to the city's satisfaction, then the city shall so notify the Grantee in writing. 
(d)  The city may then at any time upon its own motion, after a public hearing of which grantee shall be given at least thirty (30) days advance written notice and at which time grantee will be given an opportunity to be heard and present evidence, revoke the franchise. For purposes of judicial appeal of any revocation by the city, the findings of fact made by the city shall be considered final and not subject to judicial review. 
    Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, no penalty or sanction of any kind, including revocation, shall be imposed where the failure, the omission or delay on the part of the grantee is due to an Act of God or other reason beyond the grantee's control. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § XIII, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:49.5. - Penalties. 
    Grantees shall pay as liquidated damages for violation of or failure to comply with any provision of this franchise five hundred dollars ($500.00). Each day failure to comply with any provision of this chapter or franchise continued shall constitute a separate violation. The penalties hereunder may be imposed by the city only after grantee has been provided with notice of any violation and given thirty (30) days in which to cure such violation or to present excuses or explanations satisfactory to the city council, in its sole discretion; and after hearing has been held at which grantee shall be provided due process including the right to present evidence and cross examine witnesses and to have a written transcript made at its expense. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § XIV, 12-14-99) 
Sec. 8:49.6. - Authorization. 
    That the City of Eunice [sic] and they are hereby, authorized, directed and empowered to issue the annexation herein provided for, and the city clerk of the City of Eunice shall attest to same under the seal of the City of Eunice, St. Landry Parish, Louisiana, and this Ordinance No. 1199(A) shall be deemed a part hereof. 
(Ord. No. 1199(A), § XV, 12-14-99) 
PART IV. - PAYMENT OF PUBLIC, EDUCATIONAL, GOVERNMENTAL ACCESS PROGRAMMING SUPPORT TO THE CITY; REQUIRED[4] 

Footnotes: 
--- (4) --- 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 11-08A, adopted Nov. 11, 2008, did not specifically amend the Code and has been codified herein as Chapter 8, Part IV, at the discretion of the editor. 

Sec. 8:49.7. - Cable or video service providers operating within the city's municipal limits. 
(a)  The city has requested those entities providing cable or video services within the municipal limits of the city to provide public, educational, and governmental access programming, streams, or channels ("PEG") and desires to collect PEG access support from these cable or video service providers pursuant to the provisions of LRS 45:1370. 
(b)  Pursuant to the provisions of LRS 45:1361 et seq., providers of cable or video services holding a state-issued certificate of franchise authority as provided in LRS 45:1361 et seq. and operating within the city's municipal limits shall pay to the city an amount equal to one-half (1/2) percent of the gross revenues, as that term is defined by the "Consumer Choice for Television Act of 2008," derived from operations within the city's municipal limits. 
(Ord. No. 11-08A, 11-11-08) 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 11-08A, adopted Nov. 11, 2008, did not specifically amend the Code and has been codified herein as § 8:49.7 at the discretion of the editor. 
Sec. 8:49.8. - Franchise fee to be paid by those entities providing cable or video service within the city's municipal limits. 
(a)  Pursuant to the provisions of LRS 45:1366, the holder of a state-issued certificate of franchise authority for cable or video service is required to pay a franchise fee to a municipality in which it operates upon the passage of an ordinance by municipality setting such a fee. 
(b)  There are persons or entities which operate or desire to operate cable or video services within the city's municipal limits. 
(c)  All persons or entities providing cable or video services to the citizens of the city, pursuant to a state-issued certificate of franchise authority as provided in LRS 45:1361 et seq. shall, pursuant to the provisions of LRS 45:1366, pay the city a franchise fee equal to ___% of the cable or video service provider's gross revenues, as that term is defined by the "Consumer Choice for Television Act of 2008," derived from operations within the city's municipal limits. 
(Ord. No. 11-08(B), 11-11-08) 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 11-08(B), adopted Nov. 11, 2008, did not specifically amend the Code and has been codified herein as § 8:49.8 at the discretion of the editor. 
SUBCHAPTER B. - ELECTRICITY 
PART I. - CENTRAL LOUISIANA ELECTRIC COMPANY[5] 

Footnotes: 
--- (5) --- 
Editor's note- Ordinance No. 14-88, §§ 1-7, adopted Nov. 8, 1988, being not specifically amendatory of the Code, has been treated as superseding former Subch. B of Ch. 8, §§ 8:50-8:57, which pertained to similar subject matter and was derived from Ord. No. A-329, §§ 1-8, adopted March 14, 1967. 

Sec. 8:50. - Grant of franchise to Central Louisiana Electric Company (Cleco). 
    Central Louisiana Electric Company, Inc., hereinafter designated as the "company" (a Louisiana corporation domiciled and doing business in the State of Louisiana), its successors and assigns, be and is hereby granted the right, privilege and franchise of producing (including the right to construct, maintain and operate electric power plants) and/or otherwise acquiring, transmitting, distributing and selling electricity (for light, heat, power and other purposes) to the municipality and the inhabitants thereof, which right, privilege and franchise shall be deemed to include the right, authority and privilege to construct, maintain and operate in, along, under and upon the present and future streets, alleys, bridges and public ways and places of the municipality lines with all necessary or desirable appurtenances (including poles, wires, transformers, street and other lights, towers, aerial and underground transmission and distribution lines, conduits and apparatus) for the purpose of supplying and/or selling electricity for light, heat, power and other purposes to the municipality and the inhabitants thereof. 
(Ord. No. 14-88, § 1, 11-8-88) 
Sec. 8:51. - Obligation of company to maintain and extend system. 
    The company, its successors and assigns, shall at all times maintain its electric transmission and distribution systems in a safe and good condition, and shall comply with all necessary and reasonable safety regulations in the operation thereof, and shall protect and save harmless the municipality from all claims and damages due to the company's negligence or the company's failure to comply with any obligations of this franchise. The company, its successors and assigns, shall extend said electric aerial transmission and distribution systems, from time to time, as may be necessary to the end that the municipality and the inhabitants thereof shall be afforded adequate service, commensurate with the demands therefor, whenever the estimated earnings from any extension shall be sufficient to pay the cost of giving aerial service thereon, including depreciation and a fair return on the property used and useful in giving such service. 
(Ord. No. 14-88, § 2, 11-8-88) 
Sec. 8:52. - Changes to company lines. 
    All changes made necessary in the company's transmission lines in connection with the improvements of streets, roads, bridges, alleys or other public places shall be made by the company, its successors or assigns, who shall likewise repair all damage to the streets, roads, bridges, alleys or other public places caused by the construction or maintenance of said transmission lines. 
(Ord. No. 14-88, § 3, 11-8-88) 
Sec. 8:53. - Right to formulate rules and regulations. 
    The company, its successors and assigns, shall have the right to formulate and publish rules and regulations under which service will be furnished, subject to the approval of the legally constituted authorities having jurisdiction over such matters, which regulations may provide for the payment, on or before a specified day each month, for all service furnished for the preceding month, with right to disconnect and discontinue service to all delinquents. 
(Ord. No. 14-88, § 4, 11-8-88) 
Sec. 8:54. - Franchise not exclusive; term. 
    This franchise and the rights, authorities and privileges herein granted are not exclusive and are granted for a period of thirty (30) years from and after date the ordinance from which it is derived becomes effective. 
(Ord. No. 14-88, § 5, 11-8-88) 
Sec. 8:55. - Franchise fees. 
(a)  In consideration of the grant of this franchise, the company agrees to pay to the municipality, during the effective period of this franchise, a sum of money equal to four (4) percent of the amounts received by the company from the sale and delivery of electric energy at retail for residential and commercial purposes based on residential and commercial net rates approved by the Louisiana Public Service Commission billed for service within the limits of the municipality. It is understood and agreed that no payment shall be due to the municipality by the company on amounts receivable from the following classifications of sales: 
(1)  Sales of electricity for resale. 
(2)  Sales of electricity to the municipality and to other public authorities, including, but not limited to, the United States of America, the State of Louisiana and its political subdivisions, including parishes and other municipalities, and all divisions and agencies of any of the foregoing. 
(3)  Sales of electricity to industrial customers who are identified as those who engage in the business of working raw materials into wares suitable for use or which give new shapes, qualities or combinations to matter which already has gone through some artificial process and who are billed on or the equivalent of rate schedules GS or LPS on file with the Louisiana Public Service Commission or any rate schedules amending or superseding those rate schedules or any rate schedules filed with the Louisiana Public Service Commission having application to industrial use. 
(b)  The period for which the amount payable under this section shall be computed will commence when this franchise becomes effective, and the amount shall be paid quarterly, the quarterly periods being fixed on a calendar-year basis. The payments on a quarterly basis shall be made not later than thirty (30) days after the end of each quarter; that is, on or before April 30, July 30, October 30, and January 30 of each year. On the payment date the company shall furnish to the municipality a statement showing the total of such amounts receivable by the company for the preceding quarterly period to which payment of four (4) percent is applicable. The payments herein provided to be made by the company to the municipality will be reduced in an amount equal to the sum of any new or increased taxes of any nature whatsoever levied by the municipality and payable by the company subsequent to the date of this franchise (except uniform ad valorem taxes, that is, any uniform taxes based on property values). 
(Ord. No. 14-88, § 6(a), 11-8-88) 
Sec. 8:56. - Street lighting an obligation of company. 
    The company shall be obligated during the term of this franchise to furnish, operate and maintain a system for lighting the streets of the municipality and to furnish electric energy for other requirements of the municipality for facilities owned and operated by the municipality, all at costs to the municipality, as agreed upon by the municipality and the company under contracts to be entered into hereafter; provided, however, that the validity of this franchise shall not in any way be contingent upon the existence or validity of any such contracts. 
(Ord. No. 14-88, § 6(b), 11-8-88) 
Sec. 8:57. - Application of franchise rights and obligations. 
    All of the franchise rights and obligations created hereunder shall be applicable to electric service by the company within the corporate limits of the municipality as same may now or hereafter lawfully exist. The municipality shall provide to the company in writing a legal description of said corporate limits as of the effective date of this franchise and shall immediately provide to the company in writing all changes therein. All obligations of the company under sections 8:55 and 8:56 of this franchise shall be based upon the last designation of the corporate limits made by the municipality to the company pursuant to this section. 
(Ord. No. 14-88, § 7, 11-8-88) 
PART II. - SOUTHWEST LOUISIANA ELECTRIC MEMBERSHIP CORPORATION 

Sec. 8:58. - Grant of franchise. 
    The city does hereby give, grant and/or transfer unto SLEMCO, its successors and/or assigns a nonexclusive franchise which includes without any limitation the right and privilege for SLEMCO to distribute, deliver, sell and/or supply electricity and/or electric energy and/or electric service to any and all residential and/or commercial consumers in the city, including but without limitation, to any persons, firms, corporations, partnerships, parties and/or entities located throughout any and all areas of the corporate limits of the city as the same now exist or as the corporate limits may be extended from time to time during the term of this franchise agreement. 
(Ord. No. 12-05(B), Att. § 1, 12-13-05; Ord. No. 02-07(A), § 1, 2-13-07) 
Sec. 8:59. - Rights. 
    Subject only to the applicable three-hundred-foot (300) rule provisions as have been enacted by the Louisiana Public Service Commission (LPSC), this franchise agreement does further give and grant unto SLEMCO the right to acquire, erect, construct, operate and maintain such plants, structures, transmission lines and/or systems, distribution lines and/or systems, cables, fibers, facilities and equipment as may be useful or necessary for the generation, production, transportation, distribution, delivery and/or sale of electric power and/or electric energy through the city which includes the right to erect, operate and maintain poles, lines, masts, supports, wires, cables, fibers, installations, transformers, braces, guys, transmission lines, conduits, conductors, substances, distribution systems and any and all other appliances, attachments and appurtenances useful or necessary in connection with the sale, transportation, delivery and/or distribution of electricity, electric energy, electric service on, over, under, along, upon and across all of the present and/or future streets, roads, highways, alleys and public places of the city. SLEMCO is further given the right to repair, replace or remove any portions of the aforesaid and shall be allowed to connect such facilities to any other facilities necessary for the purpose of selling, transporting and/or distributing electric service into, through or beyond the boundaries of the city. 
(Ord. No. 12-05(B), Att. § 2, 12-13-05; Ord. No. 02-07(A), § 2, 2-13-07) 
Sec. 8:60. - Notification by city of change in corporate limits; payment of franchise fee. 
    It is understood by and between the parties hereto that the city shall provide to SLEMCO in writing a legal description of the corporate limits of the city and the city shall notify SLEMCO in writing of each annexation of property into the corporate limits during the term of this franchise agreement. Payments of all franchise fees by SLEMCO to the city shall begin thirty (30) days after said notifications are given to SLEMCO. The franchise fees, however, shall be paid only for customers that SLEMCO is then serving within the annexed area. 
(Ord. No. 12-05(B), Att. § 3, 12-13-05; Ord. No. 02-07(A), § 3, 2-13-07) 
Sec. 8:61. - Rates; maintenance of services. 
    The parties further agree that the services to be rendered by SLEMCO as above described shall be in such manner and from such sources as SLEMCO chooses and shall be provided at rates which shall be equal to the rates charged by SLEMCO in the general area, as approved by the Louisiana Public Service Commission. The reading of meters, services, repairs, construction, billing and collecting for services rendered shall all be in accordance with the usual customary policies and procedures of SLEMCO; which are applicable in the general area. 
(Ord. No. 12-05(B), Att. § 4, 12-13-05; Ord. No. 02-07(A), § 4, 2-13-07) 
Sec. 8:62. - Cutting and trimming of trees, etc. 
    SLEMCO is hereby granted the right and privilege of cutting and trimming trees, shrubbery and vegetation on all city rights-of-way in order to properly maintain its electric lines and electric service, and to cut down, from time to time, all dead, weak, leaning or dangerous trees, shrubbery, etc., that are tall enough to strike or endanger its lines and distribution system. SLEMCO agrees and binds and obligates itself to fully protect and indemnify the city from any and all claims, demands, causes of action, damages and expenses arising because of such trimming, cutting or removal of trees, shrubbery and vegetation pursuant to this franchise agreement. 
(Ord. No. 12-05(B), Att. § 5, 12-13-05; Ord. No. 02-07(A), § 5, 2-13-07) 
Sec. 8:63. - Maintenance of lines and infrastructure. 
    It is understood by the parties that all changes or rearrangements made necessary in SLEMCO distribution and/or transmission lines in connection with the improvements of streets, lanes, public roads, bridges, or other public places shall be made by SLEMCO, its successors or assigns, at no cost to the city and SLEMCO shall likewise repair all damages to the streets, lanes, public roads, bridges, or other public places caused by the construction or maintenance of its said distribution and transmission lines. 
(Ord. No. 12-05(B), Att. § 6, 12-13-05; Ord. No. 02-07(A), § 6, 2-13-07) 
Sec. 8:64. - Indemnification. 
    SLEMCO agrees and binds and obligates itself to fully protect and indemnify the city from any and all third party claims, demands, actions, causes of action, damages, and expenses arising as a result of the construction, erection, maintenance, and operation of the SLEMCO electrical transmission and distribution lines and system within the corporate limits of the city. The foregoing notwithstanding, the aforesaid indemnity does not apply to the city or its employees, agents, and/or representatives if the city, or its employees, agents, and/or representatives are negligent. 
(Ord. No. 12-05(B), Att. § 7, 12-13-05; Ord. No. 02-07(A), § 7, 2-13-07) 
Sec. 8:65. - Revenues. 
    For and in consideration of the franchise herein granted and all of the rights and privileges herein granted to SLEMCO, it is understood and agreed that SLEMCO shall collect and pay the city a monthly franchise fee, for the use of its public rights-of-way and for the privilege of selling electricity within the corporate limits of the city, the sum of which shall be equal to four (4) percent of gross revenues collected by SLEMCO from the metered kilowatt-hour consumption sold by SLEMCO to its customers within the corporate limits of the city and based on SLEMCO rates as approved by the Louisiana Public Service Commission. Gross revenues as above referred to shall not include the following: 
(a)  Revenue received by SLEMCO from billing to city accounts. 
(b)  Revenue from the kilowatt-hour consumption derived from selling or exchanging power to or with other utilities. 
(c)  Revenue received from collection of delinquent fees. 
(d)  Revenues derived from collections for payments of any taxes or assessments, which are remitted directly to and on behalf of any federal, state, parish, municipal or local governmental units. 
(e)  SLEMCO revenues not attaching to electric energy sales. 
(f)  Revenues received from industrial customers involved in manufacturing processes. 
(Ord. No. 12-05(B), Att. § 8, 12-13-05; Ord. No. 02-07(A), § 8, 2-13-07) 
Sec. 8:66. - Payments. 
(a)  It is understood and agreed by the parties that the payment aforesaid shall be made at such intervals and pursuant to such accounting as is mutually agreed upon between the city and SLEMCO, provided, however, that all payments made pursuant to this agreement shall be reconciled at the close of the calendar year by statements showing the gross revenue collected by SLEMCO from the retail sale and delivery of electric energy in the city corporate limits. Subject to other provisions of this franchise agreement and the total amount due to the city listed thereon and any amount not theretofore paid before the close of the said calendar year shall be paid by SLEMCO within thirty (30) days after the end of the calendar year. 
(b)  It is further understood and agreed by the parties that these franchise payments herein provided to be made by SLEMCO to the city will be reduced in an amount equal to the sum of any new or increased taxes of any nature whatsoever levied by the city and payable by SLEMCO, subsequent to the date of this franchise agreement (except uniform taxes based on property value). 
(Ord. No. 12-05(B), Att. §§ 9, 10, 12-13-05; Ord. No. 02-07(A), §§ 9, 10, 2-13-07) 
Sec. 8:67. - Term; service area; application. 
    It is further understood and agreed by and between the parties hereto that the right, privilege, and franchise hereby granted SLEMCO shall commence on March 1, 2007, and end on November 7, 2018. This franchise agreement hereby granted automatically applies to and includes all of the corporate limits of city as same now exist and as the said corporate limits may be extended from time to time during this period. 
(Ord. No. 12-05(B), Att. § 11, 12-13-05; Ord. No. 02-07(A), § 11, 2-13-07) 
Sec. 8:68. - Customer service charge; billing. 
    In the event that the city shall at any time elect to levy a city consumer service charge on SLEMCO customers within the city, it is understood and agreed that SLEMCO shall bill and collect for and on behalf of the city such city consumer service charges, which amounts shall be shown separately on the bills as an amount being charged by the city and collected on its behalf by SLEMCO. The amount of this charge shall be determined by the mayor and city council. There shall be excepted from the foregoing: 
(1)  Those charges for kilowatt-hours unpaid by customers; and 
(2)  Those receipts billed to the city. 
It is understood and agreed that the payments to the city for the aforesaid amounts collected by SLEMCO on behalf of the city shall be made monthly and pursuant to such accounting as is mutually agreed upon between the city and SLEMCO; provided, however, that all such payments made pursuant to this agreement shall be reconciled at the close of each calendar year by statements showing the total kilowatt-hours to which the charges apply and the total amount due to the city and any amounts not therefore paid to the close of the said calendar year shall be paid by SLEMCO within thirty (30) days after the end of the said calendar year. 
(Ord. No. 12-05(B), Att. § 12, 12-13-05; Ord. No. 02-07(A), § 12, 2-13-07) 
Sec. 8:69. - Severability. 
    If any provision, part, word, section, subsection, sentence, clause or phrase of this franchise agreement should be held invalid by a court of competent jurisdiction, such decision shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions of this franchise agreement. The parties do hereby declare the provisions hereof to be severable and in the event that a particular provision, part, word, section, subsection, sentence, clause or phrase should be deemed unconstitutional or invalid, the remaining provisions, parts, words, sections, subsections, sentences, clauses and phrases will not be affected and shall continue in full force and effect. 
(Ord. No. 12-05(B), Att. § 13, 12-13-05; Ord. No. 02-07(A), § 13, 2-13-07) 
PART III. - CLECO POWER LLC 

Sec. 8:70. - Grant of franchise. 
    Cleco Power LLC ("company"), a Louisiana limited liability company, domiciled and doing business in the State of Louisiana, its successors and assigns, is hereby granted the right, privilege and franchise of producing (including the right to construct, maintain and operate electric power plants) and/or otherwise acquiring, transmitting, distributing and selling electricity (for light, heat, power and other purposes) to the municipality and the inhabitants thereof, which right, privilege and franchise shall be deemed to include the right, authority and privilege to construct, maintain and operate in, along, under and upon the present and future streets, alleys, bridges and public ways and places of said municipality, lines with all necessary or desirable appurtenances (including poles, wires, transformers, street and other lights, towers, aerial and underground transmission and distribution lines, conduits and apparatus) for the purpose of supplying and/or selling electricity for light, heat, power and other purposes to the said municipality and the inhabitants thereof. 
(Ord. No. 0515, § 1, 6-9-15) 
Sec. 8:71. - Company obligation to maintain and extend system. 
    The company, its successors and assigns, shall at all times maintain its electric transmission and distribution systems in a safe and good condition and shall comply with all necessary and reasonable safety regulations in the operation thereof, and shall protect and save harmless the municipality from all claims and damages due to the company's negligence, or the company's failure to comply with any obligations of this franchise; and the company, its successors and assigns, shall extend said electric aerial transmission and distribution systems, from time to time, as may be necessary to the end that the said municipality and the inhabitants thereof shall be afforded adequate service, commensurate with the demands therefor, whenever the estimated earnings from any extension shall be sufficient to pay the cost of giving aerial service thereon, including depreciation and a fair return on the property used and useful in giving such service. 
(Ord. No. 0515, § 2, 6-9-15) 
Sec. 8:72. - Assumption of expense for improvements and repairs. 
    If the municipality makes improvements to its municipality-owned streets, roads, bridges, alleys or other public places which result in necessary changes, such as removal, replacement, or relocation, of the company's transmission and distribution lines or other infrastructure the necessary changes shall be made by the company, its successors or assigns, who shall likewise repair all damage to the streets, roads, bridges, alleys or other public places caused by the construction or maintenance of said transmission and distribution lines at the municipality's expense. If the company makes necessary changes, such as removal, replacement, or relocation of its transmission and distribution lines or other infrastructure which results in damage to the municipality-owned streets, roads, bridges, alleys, or other public places the company, its successors or assigns, shall repair all damage to the streets, roads, bridges, alleys, or other public places at its own expense. 
(Ord. No. 0515, § 3, 6-9-15) 
Sec. 8:73. - Right to formulate rules and regulations. 
    The company, its successors and assigns, shall have the right to formulate and publish rules and regulations under which service will be furnished subject to the approval of the legally constituted authorities having jurisdiction over such matters; which regulations may provide for the payment, on or before a specified day each month, for all service furnished for the preceding month, with the right to disconnect and discontinue service to all delinquents. 
(Ord. No. 0515, § 4, 6-9-15) 
Sec. 8:74. - Term. 
    That this franchise and the rights, authorities and privileges herein granted are not exclusive and are granted for a period of thirty-three (33) years from and after the date the ordinance codified in this part becomes effective. 
(Ord. No. 0515, § 5, 6-9-15) 
Sec. 8:75. - Franchise fees. 
    In consideration of the grant of this franchise: 
(a)  The company agrees to pay to the municipality during the effective period of this franchise, a sum of money equal to four (4) percent of the amounts received by the company from the sale and delivery of kilowatt hours of electric energy at retail for residential and commercial purposes based on residential and commercial net rates approved by the Louisiana Public Service Commission billed for service within the limits of said municipality, exclusive of taxes and all governmental fees and impositions shown on such bills. It is understood and agreed that no payment shall be due to the municipality by the company on amounts received from the following classifications of sales and service: 
(1)  Sales or distribution of electricity for resale. 
(2)  Sales or distribution of electricity to the municipality and to other public authorities, including, but not limited to, the United States of America, the State of Louisiana and its political subdivisions, including parishes and other municipalities, and all divisions and agencies of any of the foregoing. 
(3)  Sales or distribution of electricity to industrial customers who are identified as those who engage in the business of working raw materials into wares suitable for use or which gives new shapes, qualities or combinations to matter which already has gone through some artificial process and who are billed on or the equivalent of rate schedules GS or LPS on file with the Louisiana Public Service Commission or any rate schedules amending or superseding those rate schedules or any rate schedules filed with the Louisiana Public Service Commission having application to industrial use. 
The period for which the amount payable under this section shall be computed will commence when this franchise agreement becomes effective, and the amount shall be paid quarterly, the quarterly periods being fixed on a calendar year basis, and the payments on a quarterly basis shall be made not later than thirty (30) days after the end of each quarter, that is, on or before April 30, July 31, October 31 and January 31 of each year, and on the payment date the company shall furnish to the municipality a statement showing the total of such amounts received by the company for the preceding quarterly period to which payment of four (4) percent is applicable. The payments herein provided to be made by the company to the municipality will be reduced in an amount equal to the sum of any new or increased taxes of any nature whatsoever levied by the municipality and payable by the company, subsequent to the date this franchise agreement is adopted (except uniform ad valorem taxes, that is, any uniform taxes based on property values). New taxes or an increase on taxes charged to the customers of company by the municipality, collected by company, and payable to the municipality shall not be considered taxes payable by the company, and any such tax shall not reduce the amounts owed by company to the municipality pursuant to this franchise agreement. 
(b)  The company shall be obligated during the term of this franchise to furnish, operate and maintain a system for lighting the streets of the municipality, and to furnish electric energy for other requirements of the municipality for facilities owned and operated by the municipality, all at costs to the municipality, as agreed upon by the municipality and the company under existing contracts or contracts to be entered into hereafter; provided, however, that the validity of this franchise shall not in any way be contingent upon the existence or validity of any such contracts. 
(Ord. No. 0515, § 6, 6-9-15) 
Sec. 8:76. - Rates charged in event of utility deregulation. 
    Notwithstanding any other provisions of this franchise agreement to the contrary, including without limitation, Section 8:75 hereof, in the event of: 
(1)  Deregulation of the electric utility industry in Louisiana as the result of any applicable law or any order, rule or regulation of the Louisiana Public Service Commission or any regulatory body having jurisdiction over the company; and 
(2)  Company ceases to generate electric energy as a regulated electric public utility for sale to the public; and 
(3)  Company distributes kilowatt hours of electric energy to customers in the municipality which has been generated by company or others; 
then the provisions of Section 8:75, paragraph (a), subparagraphs (1)-(3) hereof, shall no longer apply, and in that event, company shall thereafter pay to municipality four (4) percent of only those amounts received by company from its customers solely for the distribution of kilowatt hours of electric energy to its customers located within the municipality, based on residential and commercial net rates approved by the Louisiana Public Commission, exclusive of taxes and all governmental fees and impositions shown on the bills for such service; and, without limitation of the foregoing, there shall be excluded from those amounts: 
(a)  All charges made to said customers by the party who generated and/or supplied and/or sold said kilowatt hours of electric energy which was distributed to said customers by company; 
(b)  All charges made by company to any customer for kilowatt hours of electric energy purchased by company from an electric generator or supplier because such customer had not purchased electric energy from an electric generator or supplier; and 
(c)  All charges and amounts received by company from customers on behalf of any electric generator or supplier for the sale of kilowatt hours of electric energy to said customers by said electric generator or supplier. 
(Ord. No. 0515, § 7, 6-9-15) 
Sec. 8:77. - Designation of corporate limits. 
    All of the franchise rights and obligations created hereunder shall be applicable to sales and/or distribution of electric energy by the company within the corporate limits of the municipality as same may now or hereafter lawfully exist. The municipality shall provide to the company in writing a legal description of said corporate limits as of the effective date of this franchise and shall immediately provide to the company in writing all changes therein. All obligations of the company under Sections 8:75 and 8:76 of this franchise shall be based upon the last designation of the corporate limits made by the municipality to the company pursuant to this section. 
(Ord. No. 0515, § 8, 6-9-15) 
Sec. 8:78. - Repealer. 
    All ordinances or parts of ordinances contrary to or in conflict with the provisions of this franchise agreement be and the same are hereby repealed, and this franchise agreement shall take effect from and after its promulgation in full and its acceptance in writing by the company for itself, its successors and assigns. 
(Ord. No. 0515, § 9, 6-9-15) 
Secs. 8:79-8:99. - Reserved. 
SUBCHAPTER C. - PIPELINES 

Sec. 8:100. - Grant of franchise/right-of-way to Michigan Wisconsin Pipe Line Company. 
(a)  The mayor of the City of Eunice be and he is hereby authorized to execute a right-of-way to and in favor of Michigan Wisconsin Pipe Line Company in the form attached to the application of said company, the form thereof being hereby approved; and the consideration for such grant be the sum of forty-two dollars ($42.00). 
(b)  This franchise shall grant Michigan Wisconsin Pipe Line Company a right of way to construct, maintain and operate a certain pipeline, together with related rights and facilities, upon, over and under certain lands located in Acadia Parish, Louisiana, described in said right-of-way as: 
    A certain tract or parcel of land containing three and 46/100 (3.46) acres situated in Section 37, T-7-S, R-1-W, Acadia Parish, Louisiana, being more particularly described as beginning at a point N 59° 00' E, 1502.0 feet and S 13° 58' E, 1851.8 feet from the southwest corner of Section 1, T-7-S, R-1-W; thence from point of beginning S 76° 02' W, 320.0 feet; thence S 13° 58' E, 322.0 feet; thence S 60° 23' E, 300.5 feet; thence S 69° 08' E, 124.5 feet; thence N 13° 58' W, 600.0 feet to point of beginning, being bounded as follows: North, South and West, now or formerly by Adeline Ardoin Ledoux, et al, and East by City of Eunice Airport, all as shown by Map of Survey made by Lindsey J. Aucoin, Civil Engineer, dated November 20, 1964. 
    A certain tact or parcel of land containing one and 91/100 (1.91) acres situated in Section 37, T-7-S, R-1-W, Acadia Parish, Louisiana, being more particularly described as beginning at a point N 59° 00' E, 2026.7 feet and S 13° 58' E, 41.8 feet from the Southwest corner of Section 1, T-7-S, R-1-W, Acadia Parish, Louisiana; thence from point of beginning S 13° 58' E, 6350 feet; thence N 7° 00' W, 107.2 feet; thence N 13° 58' W, 6247.7 feet; thence S 59° 00' W, 13.6 feet to point of beginning, being bounded as follows: North and East, now or formerly by Adeline Ardoin Ledoux, et al, South by a point being and/or the southeast corner of the City of Eunice Airport site, and West by City of Eunice Airport site; all as shown by a map of Survey made by Lindsey J. Aucoin, Civil Engineer, dated November 20, 1964. 
    A certain tract or parcel of land, together with all buildings and improvements thereon, if any, containing 72.05 acres, more or less, situated in Section 37, Township 7 South, Range 1 West of the Louisiana Meridian in Acadia Parish, Louisiana, said tract of land being more particularly described as beginning at a point which point is North 59° 0' East 1502 feet and South 13° 58' East 41.8 feet from the southwest corner of Section One (1), Township 7 South, Range 1 West of the Louisiana Meridian in Acadia Parish, Louisiana; thence, from said point of beginning running South 13° 58' East a distance of 6200 feet; thence running North 75° 32' East a distance of 500 feet; thence running North 13° 58' West a distance of 6350 feet; thence running South 59° 0' West a distance of 524.7 feet to point of beginning. 
(Ord. No. 4-72 of April 11, 1972, as re-enacted by Ord. No. 5-72 of April 11, 1972)

Secs. 8:101-8:149. - Reserved. 
SUBCHAPTER D. - WATER 
PART I. - CLECO WATER FRANCHISE 

Sec. 8:150. - Grant of water franchise to Central Louisiana Electric Company Incorporated (Cleco). 
    Central Louisiana Electric Company, Inc., hereinafter designated as "company" (a Louisiana corporation), its successors and assigns, be and it is hereby granted the right, privilege and franchise to supply (including the right to construct, maintain and operate water utility plants) and/or otherwise acquiring, transmitting, distributing, and selling water to the City of Eunice and the inhabitants thereof; and which right, privilege and franchise shall be deemed to include the right, authority and privilege to construct, maintain and operate in, along and upon the present and future streets, alleys, bridges and public ways and places of said municipality, lines with all the necessary and/or desirable appurtenances (including transmission and distribution pipe lines and all accessories and auxiliary equipment necessary thereto) for the purpose of supplying and/or selling water to the said municipality and inhabitants thereof. 
(Ord. No. A-328, § 1, 3-14-67) 
Sec. 8:151. - Cleco water franchise, duties of grantee. 
    The company, its successors and/or assigns, shall at all times maintain its water transmission and distribution systems in good condition and maintain at all times therein water in sufficient amount and pressure as to give adequate service commensurate with the demands thereof, and shall comply with all reasonable safety practices in the operation thereof and shall protect and save harmless the municipality from all claims and damages due to its negligence or its failure to comply with any obligations of this franchise; and said company, its successors and/or assigns, shall extend said water transmission and distribution systems, as may be necessary to the end that the said municipality and the inhabitants thereof shall be given adequate service, commensurate with the demands therefor, be made to the municipality by any governmental agency and which the municipality may hereafter, by majority vote, request of company. 
(Ord. No. A-328, § 2, 3-14-67) 
Sec. 8:152. - Cleco water franchise, work of grantee subject to inspection by the city; restoration of damages. 
    All construction done and/or excavations made by the company, in connection with its water transmission and distribution systems, shall be subject to inspection by the municipal engineers, and the company shall without undue delay restore to their former condition, any sidewalks, streets, alleys, public ways, and places of the municipality, all to the exclusive satisfaction of said municipal engineers. 
(Ord. No. A-328, § 3, 3-14-67) 
Sec. 8:153. - Cleco water franchise, authority to adopt rules and regulations. 
    The company, it successors and assigns, shall have the right to formulate and publish rules and regulations under which service will be furnished, subject to approval of the governing body then having jurisdiction and which shall stipulate for the payment for service furnished on or before the specified day of each month, with the right to disconnect and discontinue service to all delinquents. Nothing herein contained shall be construed however as imposing any liability whatever on the municipality for any acts or omissions of the company resulting from any rules or regulations it may hereafter promulgate as a result hereof even though same may have been approved by the municipality. 
(Ord. No. A-328, § 4, 3-14-67) 
Sec. 8:154. - Cleco water franchise, length of franchise. 
    The franchise and the rights, authorities and privileges herein granted are not exclusive, but are granted for a period of twenty-five (25) years from March 14, 1967. 
(Ord. No. A-328, § 5, 3-14-67) 
Secs. 8:155-8:170. - Reserved. 
PART II. - LOUISIANA WATER COMPANY (LAWCO) 

Sec. 8:171. - Grant of franchise. 
    That Louisiana Water Company, hereinafter designated as "LAWCO", (a Louisiana corporation) domiciled and doing business in the State of Louisiana, its successors and assigns, be and said LAWCO is hereby granted the right, privilege and franchise of producing and/or otherwise acquiring, transmitting, distributing and selling water to said municipality, and the inhabitants thereof, with right, authority and privilege to construct, maintain and operate in, along and upon the present and future streets, alleys, bridges and public ways and places of said municipality, lines with all necessary appurtenances for the purpose of supplying and/or selling water to the said municipality and the inhabitants thereof. 
(Ord. No. 0617(A) , § 1, 7-11-17) 
Sec. 8:172. - Duties of grantee. 
    That LAWCO, its successors and assigns, shall at all times maintain its water transmission and distribution systems in good condition, and shall comply with all reasonable safety regulations in the operation thereof, and shall maintain water in sufficient amount and pressure at all times to give adequate service commensurate with the demands thereof and shall comply with all reasonable safety practices in the operation thereof, and shall protect and save harmless the city from all claims and damages due to its negligence or its failure to comply with any obligations of this franchise; and that said LAWCO, its successors or assigns, shall extend said water transmission and distribution systems, from time to time, as may be necessary to the end that the said municipality and the inhabitants thereof shall be given adequate service, commensurate with the demands therefore, provided the estimated earnings from any required extensions shall be sufficient to pay the cost of service there from, including depreciation and a fair return on the property used and useful in providing such service. 
(Ord. No. 0617(A) , § 2, 7-11-17) 
Sec. 8:173. - Work of grantee subject to inspection by the city; restoration of damages. 
    That all construction done and/or excavations made by LAWCO in connection with its water distribution system shall be subject to inspection by the municipal engineer and LAWCO shall, without undue delay, restore to their former condition any sidewalks, streets, roads, bridges, alleys and other public places caused by the construction or maintenance of said distribution system. 
(Ord. No. 0617(A) , § 3, 7-11-17) 
Sec. 8:174. - Authority to adopt rules and regulations. 
    That LAWCO, its successors and assigns, shall have the right to formulate and publish rules and regulations under which service will be furnished, subject to the approval of the legally constituted authorities having jurisdiction over such matters; which regulations may provide for the payment, on or before a specified day each month, for all service furnished for the preceding month, with the right to disconnect and discontinue service to all delinquents. Nothing herein contained shall be construed, however, as imposing any liability whatever on municipality for any acts or omissions of LAWCO resulting from any rules or regulations it my hereafter promulgate as a result hereof even though same may have been approved by municipality. 
(Ord. No. 0617(A) , § 4, 7-11-17) 
Sec. 8:175. - Franchise tax. 
    LAWCO agrees that it will, from and after the effective date hereof, collect and remit on a quarterly basis a franchise tax to Eunice which shall equal four (4) per cent of the gross water service revenues realized from metered sales during the preceding quarter to water customers located within the corporate limits of Eunice. This franchise tax shall be in lieu of any and all other excise and/or gross receipts taxes. 
(Ord. No. 0617(A) , § 5, 7-11-17) 
Sec. 8:176. - Length of franchise. 
    The franchise and the rights, authorities and privileges herein granted are not exclusive and are granted for a period of twenty (20) years from and after the date on which this part becomes effective. 
    Should any provision of this part be found to violate the Constitution or be illegal, it shall not affect the other provisions of this part. 
(Ord. No. 0617(A) , § 6, 7-11-17) 
Sec. 8:177. - Repealer; effective date. 
    That all ordinances or parts of ordinances contrary to or in conflict with the provisions of this part be and the same are hereby repealed, and this part shall take effect from and after its promulgation and its acceptance in writing by LAWCO for itself, its successors and assigns. 
(Ord. No. 0617(A) , § 7, 7-11-17) 
Chapter 9 - GARBAGE, TRASH AND JUNK[1] 
Footnotes: 
--- (1) --- 
Cross reference- For additional health and sanitary regulations, see Chapter 10, this Code. 

SUBCHAPTER A. - IN GENERAL 

Sec. 9:1. - Dumping of refuse or rubbish on streets or property of other prohibited. 
    No person shall place any refuse or rubbish in any street, alley, or other public place, or upon any private property, whether owned by such person or not within the corporate limits of the City of Eunice except it be in proper containers for collection as provided in subchapter B of this chapter, or as provided in this subchapter. Nor shall any person throw or deposit any refuse or rubbish in any stream, canal, drainage channel, pond, lake, or other body of water within the corporate limits of the City of Eunice, or belonging to the City of Eunice and located beyond its corporate limits. 
(Ord. No. A-290, § 2, 6-8-65; Ord. No. 05-13(A), 4-9-13) 
Comment- Ordinance No. A-290 superseded Ordinance No. A-245 which also dealt with littering. 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 05-13(A), adopted April 9, 2013, retitled § 9:1 from "Dumping of refuse or rubbish on streets or property of others prohibited" to "Dumping of refuse or rubbish on streets or property of other prohibited." 
Sec. 9:2. - Refuse and rubbish regulations, definitions. 
(a)  For the purpose of this subchapter, the following terms, phrases, words, and their derivations shall have the meaning given herein. 
(b)  Refuse is all putrescible and nonputrescible solid wastes (except body wastes), including garbage, rubbish, ashes, street cleanings, dead animals, abandoned automobiles, cigarette butts, all tobacco products and solid market and industrial wastes. 
(c)  Rubbish is nonputrescible solid wastes (excluding ashes), consisting of both combustible and noncombustible wastes, such as paper, cigarette butts, all tobacco related products, cardboard, tin cans, yard clippings, wood, glass, bedding, crockery and similar materials and garbage. 
(Ord. No. A-290, § 1, 6-8-65; Ord. No. 05-13(A), 4-9-13) 
Sec. 9:3. - Keeping or depositing refuse or rubbish in yards, streets or drainage ditches, restricted. 
    No person shall allow, keep, throw, drop, or deposit any refuse or rubbish as herein defined, or any other substance of any kind which may be offensive to the smell or injurious to the health, in any yard, lot, room or building, or on any sidewalk, street, alley, bank, drain ditch, or levee or any other public right-of-way or public place, or in any gutter or drain within the corporate limits of the City of Eunice. Nor shall any person cast, place, sweep or deposit anywhere within the city limits of the City of Eunice, any refuse or rubbish in such a manner that it may be carried or deposited by the elements upon or in any street, sidewalk, alley, sewer or any other public right-of-way or public place or into any occupied premises within the corporate limits of the City of Eunice. 
(Ord. No. A-290, § 3, 6-8-65; Ord. No. 05-13(A), 4-9-13) 
Sec. 9:4. - Refuse disposal requirements for including but not limited to, lunch stands, drug stores, restaurants. 
    All persons operating bars, lounges, lunch stands, drug stores, restaurants, hardware stores, furniture stores, or any other stores or business where litter may collect, and particularly is this true of places serving food outside, shall provide ample garbage cans or receptacles and shall at all times keep the paper, paper napkins, cardboard, cups or cans, cigarette butts or all tobacco related products, picked up and placed in these receptacles securely, and the owners, managers or operators of such shall be held responsible for the carrying out of these regulations. 
(Ord. No. A-290, § 4, 6-8-65; Ord. No. 05-13(A), 4-9-13) 
Editor's note- Ord. No. 05-13(A), adopted April 9, 2013, retitled § 9:4 from "Refuse disposal requirements for lunch stands, drug stores, restaurants" to "Refuse disposal requirements for including but not limited to, lunch stands, drug stores, restaurants." 
Sec. 9:5. - Salvaging from garbage cans, receptacles restricted. 
    It shall be unlawful for any person to salvage material from garbage cans or receptacles except by permission from the owner, and scavenging is prohibited. 
(Ord. No. A-290, § 5, 6-8-85) 
Cross reference- Similar provision, § 9:55. 
Sec. 9:6. - Violations, penalties. 
    Any person violating any of the foregoing provisions of this subchapter shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and shall, upon conviction in the city court, be subject to the penalties as provided in Section 1:21 of this Code. 
Secs. 9:07-9:39. - Reserved. 
Sec. 9:40. - Property owners required to maintain premises; requirements for stables, kennels, etc.; violations, penalties. 
(a)  In order to improve the cleanliness and sanitary condition of all premises and properties within the corporate limits of the City of Eunice, Louisiana, it is hereby made compulsory upon all property owners, residents and inhabitants of the City of Eunice, to keep their respective premises or property, at all times, in the condition following: All trash shall be raked up and hauled away; and all tall grass and weeds shall be cut down and hauled away; all stables, chicken coops, dog kennels, pens of different pets, etc., shall be kept clean and the refuse hauled away and disposed of; under the buildings, accumulated trash and rubbish shall be removed and hauled away; all holes or depressions in yards or elsewhere about the premises, where water is liable to stand, or become stagnant, must be properly drained or filled; all sanitary and other closets and urinals shall be cleaned sufficiently often to prevent them from becoming offensive in smell, or otherwise becoming a nuisance; and provided, that where any sanitary, or other closet or urinal is so constructed that the use of it becomes a nuisance, the same shall be repaired or remodeled in such a manner that the use thereof will not produce a nuisance; all lumber, bricks, etc., shall be piled up in an orderly manner and so as to not impede drainage or otherwise prove unsanitary; and any other unsanitary condition that may be about such premises or property shall be corrected upon notification by the mayor or any police or health officer of the municipality. 
(b)  Any person, property owner, tenant or occupant, or any agent or any premises or property within the corporate limits of the City of Eunice, who shall neglect or refuse to place his property or premises, or such property or premises, as may be under his care, control or custody either as occupant, owner, tenant or agent, shall, upon conviction, be subject to the penalties provided in Section 1:21 of this Code, and each day's violation of this section shall constitute a separate offense. 
(Ord. No. 118, §§ 1, 2, 8-5-19; Ord. No. 0216(A), 3-8-16) 
Editor's note- Ordinance No. 118 originally provided that property owners could burn excess refuse. At the direction of the mayor and board of aldermen, the authorization for burning was deleted. 
 Ord. No. 0216(A), adopted March 8, 2016, amended the catchline of § 9:40 to read as herein set out. Said catchline formerly read "Property owners required to maintain premises; requirements for stables, hog pens, kennels, etc.; violations, penalties. 
Sec. 9:41. - Disposition of junk, wrecked or used motor vehicles, major appliances and other junk. 
(a)  The storing or abandoning of junk, wrecked or used automobiles or motor vehicles, or any part or parts thereof, or any other junk, discarded or abandoned major appliances, such as refrigerators, freezers, ranges or machinery or other metal, tin or other discarded items, on any vacant lot, or any unused portion of any occupied lot, or neutral ground, street or sidewalk, located within the municipality is prohibited and is unlawful. 
(b)  The term "junk, wrecked or used automobile or motor vehicles" as used herein shall mean any motor vehicle which is totally inoperable or left unattended on any unused portion of any occupied lot, or on any vacant lot, or on any neutral ground, street or sidewalk, or other public property, and which does not have current tags, licenses, and auto safety inspection sticker, whether same is inoperable or not. 
(c)  The items in violation of this section shall be removed and/or disposed of after written notice of not less than (10) days is either placed on the vehicle itself or given to the owner, if known.
